admissionInfo: In the event of inclement weather, all outdoor attractions will be suspended for your safety.
body:
Offering a full day of splashing fun in the sun, Adventure Cove Waterpark is designed for thrill-seekers and families alike, promising an exhilarating day of enjoyment. Located within Resorts World Sentosa, the waterpark comprises of six waterslides and many other attractions, with a wide array of F&B offerings. It is a unique outdoor venue for fun and excitement, especially for those seeking respite from the tropical heat. Guests to the park will feel the adrenaline rush as they zip down thrill-packed water slides such as Southeast Asia’s first hydro-magnetic coaster. They can also chill out with friends and their loved ones at Bluwater Bay wave pool, or grab a tube and float down Adventure River, journeying through 14 stunning scenes including a tropical jungle garden and a grotto inhabited by mystical and fantasy-like never-before-seen marine creatures. As the region’s only waterpark with marine life elements, guests can immerse in marine habitats, such as snorkelling with thousands of fish over the colourful Rainbow Reef or sign up for an unforgettable encounter with ethereal rays.

Adventure Cove Waterpark is located at Resorts World Sentosa (RWS).
companyDisplayName: RESORTS WORLD AT SENTOSA PTE. LTD.
description: Thrilling slides and encounters with marine life – all in one place. At Adventure Cove Waterpark, you can take high-speed water slides, laze the day away drifting on a lazy river, snorkel with 20,000 tropical fish over a colourful reef, wade among rays and even come face to face with sharks! Come have fun today with us at Resorts World Sentosa! Where the water's full of life.
name: Adventure Cove Waterpark (Resorts World Sentosa)

reviews.text: Not a lot of rides I would say, but if you love the waving thingy you are in for it! The wave pools are like so huge once I almost drown luckily my father was there to save me haha.........For the food I wouldn't say is so good that you wanna jump in the swimming pool and kill yourself ,but I must say its the good old classic I used to eat in my 90s.

I like the vibes and chilling atmosphere! always coming back!

If you like water activities  then  it was made for you! I live  to visit this place otw to sentosa beach! since I love the vibes over there! I have an abonnement for 6 month.   So to  cheer myself and friends up , we will always go there!
I will start with a round river ride!
It a very crowded sometimes so I will do it during weekdays!
You can get an express pass if you dont want to wait!

Give it a try!

I did not expect this to be as great as it was. If I return to Singapore, I must go back. Their lazy river is so long and even has a few surprises to view. The snorkeling experience was MAGNIFICENT! The waterslides went from easy to thrilling. There was a wave pool and other special sections.

[Visited Nov 19] Staff are friendly and helpful. Food is at usual theme park rates ($10-20 for meal with drink). Found selection of 6 rides to be fairly limited compared to other countries, though of better quality than those found at Wild Wild Wet. Admission rates are worth it in a package with Universal Studios/ SEA Aquarium.

Adventure Cove is a good size water park with a balance range of water rides, suitable for most ages. I love water parks and got the annual pass to here.

Usually spend about half a day here. But if there is a lighting signal, everything gets such down, though they to re-open pretty quickly after the storm passes. Safe yet efficient. :)

source: RESORTS WORLD AT SENTOSA PTE. LTD.

admissionInfo:
Pre-booking is highly recommended. No pre-payment required. Book online: www.forestadventure.com.sg or call 8100 7420
Sports shoes are a must.
body: Forest Adventure is thrilling fun for the whole family. Experience balancing on some exhilarating bridges and obstacles, jumping off a Tarzan Swing or zipping through the air on one of the 6 giant zip lines, including one of 300m. There are 3 different courses allowing both children of all ages and adults to join in the fun.
description: Forest Adventure is thrilling fun for the whole family. Experience balancing on some exhilarating bridges and obstacles, jumping off a Tarzan Swing or zipping through the air on one of the 6 giant zip lines, including one of 300m over the water. There are 3 different courses allowing both children of all ages and adults to join in the fun
name: Forest Adventure - Tree Top Adventure Park
notes: Last departure 4pm

reviews.text: The kids had fun on Children's Day. Activities that built confidence & resilience & cultivate patience. For 1st timer, do allocate enough time to walk to Forest Adventure from entrance of Bedok Reservoir.. Absence of direction signs (at least we could not find them) along the way as we try to locate Forest Adventure..
If u love the outdoor, this place bring out the kid in you Endless of fun and adventure. Try out your inner spirit and let it all out. You won't regret it
Don’t order the Mac and cheese
A great place to engage the kids to explore outdoor activities. Helps them build up their confidence with height and handling of the various obstacles.

Fantastic experience. Really enjoyed it. Some very challenging course for adults and children alike. Big zip line too. Staff are very friendly, patient and helpful. Set up for Covid restrictionists and works well.

admissionInfo: Buy your tickets online and enjoy great discounts: https://sg.megaadventure.com/online-tickets/
body: MegaZip combines adrenaline, speed, and fun to let you fly like an eagle! At 75 metres high, 450 metres long and heart-pounding speed of 60kph. Challenge yourself and your friends on our 3 levels, 36 obstacles aerial adventure course (MegaClimb), a 15m free fall simulator (MegaJump) and show off your flips on our bungy assisted trampoline (MegaBounce). Suitable for the entire family and a must-do for all adventure seekers!
description: A recipient of Trip Advisor’s Traveller’s Choice Award 2019 and Certificate of Excellence for 6 consecutive years, Mega Adventure is home to the world famous Megazip, Asia’s No.1 Zipline that spans 450m, where you can fly at 60kph over Siloso Beach in Sentosa!
name: Mega Adventure Park

reviews.text: It was fun even tho i keep falling

Mega Adventure Park - Singapore is located on the picturesque Sentosa Island, host to Singapore’s main attractions.
Make like a modern day Tarzan. Soar like an eagle on the MegaZip, a 450m long zip line or test your balance on the 36-obstacle treetop ropes of MegaClimb. Try the parachute simulator MegaJump, or just test your acrobatics on the bungee-assisted trampoline at Megabounce!
The MegaZip descends at speeds up to 60Kph, as fast as the average horizontal speed of an eagle!

Exhilarating but long wait. I did the level 3 climb and i just wish there were more instructors on standby to guide.
That said the mega jump and megazip were absolutely worth the wait and money!

Really enjoyed all three experiences- climb, jump and fly.  The ropes course was challenging but good fun, the jump was good bit over too soon.   The Fly was a blast . I loved flying over the jungle and the beach   just epic.   The only reason I gave it four stars is due to the long wait to get suited up at the beginning.   There was hardly anyone in the line and only two staff on but the process seemed to take forever .  I only had 5 ppl in front of me when I lined up and it took 45 mins to get to the counter and get a harness

Zip line is awesome.
Mega climb is very tough even the easy level is tough.

body: Sentosa 4D AdventureLand is a high-tech interactive entertainment zone located at the Imbiah Lookout on Sentosa Island. It is home to a diverse collection of highly sensorial and exciting experiences for every age group. Experience 4D movie, ‘Journey 2: The Mysterious Island’, where you will be integrated into the show through a synchronisation of life-like visuals, wind, water and other special effects. Ride on the 4D motion-simulated ‘Extreme Log Ride’ through ravines and down valleys; or consider ‘Haunted Mine Ride 4D’ for an exhilarating adventure in a dilapidated and haunted gold mine. For Action Seekers, get into the middle of an action-packed shoot-out in ‘Desperados’, the first 4D interactive shoot-out game in Asia.
description: Located on the island of Sentosa, Sentosa 4D Adventureland is a high-tech interactive entertainment zone that is home to three exciting experiences for every age group.
name: Sentosa 4D AdventureLand
notes: Sentosa 4D AdventureLand is temporarily closed until further notice.

reviews.text: A good 4D ride. Get the log ride option. It is much better than others!

Brilliant experience of 4D adventure shows, for all ages. If you are trying to cover as many attractions as possible in Sentosa then this should be your last destination. Well organized and management has done a wonderful job with the queues and visual direction arrows. We somehow managed to push ourselves to cover this place at the very last.
All the 3 shows are good, the best part is, it's open till 10 pm, so after wings of time, this can be covered. I personally liked the log ride, that was adventurous and fun, the sudden movements that you get are pretty exhilarating. Overall worth the money spent and highly recommended@
Its ok, fairly basic compared to other similar ones. Picture resolution not great. Sequencing between the 4 not great either.

This is ok. Bit of fun. One particular staff - female with glasses that was working the mine ride 26-1-20, was extremely rude. Clearly In a bad mood that was made clear to all. The shooting game was good. The rides and shows are a bit outdated. The VR place near universal is a lot better.
The desparado game is slightly short for the price. 5 more minutes and it will be great.

admissionInfo: [Bicycle Rental] First Rental: 10am; Last Rental: 630pm
amenities: Shuttle to Places of Interest,Wheelchair Accessible
body:
Enjoy the lush greenery and the scenic sights of Sentosa with Gogreen Bike Rental (1 Hour) , and have fun discovering nooks and corners that you may never have known existed on Sentosa. There are 3 interconnected cycling tracks with varying degrees of difficulty. Route 1: Family Bonding - An easy route that runs on flat ground, mainly along the beach. Route 2: Fun & Nature - A route with hills and bends, providing cyclists with a moderate workout that brings them to the Imbiah Hill and nature trails. Route 3: Nature & Lifestyle - A challenging route that runs through steep slopes and dedicated on-road cycling lanes, leading to Sentosa Cove Village and Tanjong Beach.

Bicycle Rental (1hour) are now at only $9.90 from 4 September 2020 to 31 December 2020.
Bicycle Rental (2hour) are now at only $14.90 from 4 September 2020 to 31 December 2020.

Social distancing made fun with Gogreen Segway Fun Ride. Hop onto Sentosa's popular fun and family friendly Segway Fun Ride at Gogreen attraction for an introductory exciting ride on the Segway Personal Transporter. The Segway Fun Ride includes training and a short riding session suitable for anyone (including kids) above 105cm. Trainers are always on hand to assist you and in a matter of minutes, you will master this futuristic self balancing device. Over a million riders have tried the Segway Fun Ride and we welcome you to join us for this fun and safe experience.

Segway Fun Ride (500m) now at only $14.90 from 4 September 2020 to 30 September 2020
Top-Up to 800m at only $5 (Plus additional distance of 250m bringing a total of 1050m)

Segway Fun Ride Minimum height requirement: 105cm;
First Entry: 10am;
Last Entry: 7pm

Take on Asia's Most Thrilling ECO Ride and enjoy a scenic ride along Singapore’s most popular beaches with our 2-Pax Special Segway ECO Adventure (30 minutes). A thrilled-packed 30mins* experience here, we will cruise along the entire 3.2km of white sandy beaches, covering along the hip and fun-loving Siloso beach or the family-oriented Palawan beach. This is definitely an unforgettable experience.

2-Pax Special Segway ECO Adventure (30mins) are now at only $59.90 from 4 September to 30 September 2020.

Min requirements for Segway® Eco Adventure: 10 years old and above



Book your tickets now: https://www.segwaytours.com.sg
Opens 10am to 730pm Daily.
description: $9.90 Special for 1 Hour Bike Rental @ Sentosa / Segway Fun Ride Special @ $14.90
name: #Gogreen Segway Eco Adventure @ Sentosa
nearestMrtStation: Harbourfront MRT Station to Sentosa Express: Beach Station
notes: Opens 10am to 730pm Daily. Check www.segwaytours.com.sg for latest updates.

reviews.text: Visited Gogreen Segway previously to rent bicycles for 2 hours with my partner. All bicycles were brand new, variety of choice to choose from and it worked really great! Sentosa has very great view for pitstops and for leisure cycling. Customer service was tip-top and all staff were helpful when I needed help in finding the most suitable bicycle for myself. They even have Guided Segway Tours! Definitely would recommend to others.
just an extremely simple activity and overpriced for $17 in 5 min for 250m game

Contrary to what the other reviews indicate, I think Gogreen has refreshed their entire bicycle line up with new bikes. When we rented the bicycles last week, we had low expectations, but were pleasantly delighted to see all new bikes. The bicycles were either new or very well maintained, my friends and I had no issues with the bicycles we chose for our 2 hour ride.
The Chinese lady who attended to us was super courteous and accommodating! Kudos to her service, though I forgot her name.
Will come back to try their Segway rides, since Segway is now discontinued, I think there aren't many chances to ride a Segway anymore!
Also, Ola Beach Club right behind Gogreen is a great place to cool down after the ride!

Personally i cant ride a bicyle so for a family day out i decided to bring my parents for the segway fun ride! It was our very first segway ride and we were all scared at first but after a few tries, we all got a hang of it. I love how its so easy and safe for my parents and glad they enjoyed it. Since we cant travel now, this is definitely a good option for some family bonding!

Highly recommended activity for those who would like to explore the different parts of sentosa beach, without the exhaustion of walking/ cycling. Went on a weekday (before noon time) and there was no crowd at all. Overall a great experience, special thanks to Ms Nasuha for the extensive tour of the place.

body:
The future of entertainment is now here with Virtual Room – an award-winning team virtual reality experience located right in the heart of Chinatown.

Blending the escape room concept with a full 3D cinematic experience to deliver a unique, immersive and mind-blowing adventure lasting ~40-50 minutes.

Played in groups of 2, 3 or 4 players where each player has their own dedicated room - you will join each other in the virtual world where you can talk to each other, walk around, bend, throw objects and collaborate to solve the mission.

With 3 missions to choose from, you and your team of 2-4 players will travel back to historical periods of time such as ancient Egypt and the moon landing to solve the challenges and save the world! In our latest mission, you even get to BE the zombies and fight for your survival!

Guaranteed no motion sickness unlike inferior VR experiences (e.g. ones where you are sitting down or using poor quality VR headsets) It’s unlike anything you’ve ever experienced before - immersion, freedom, adrenaline, the ultimate thrill! If you’re up for the challenge, build your team now and join the adventure.

Fun for all ages (several games with no gore or horror) - friends, families (ages 10+), birthday parties, kids’ parties, hens/bucks nights, school groups and corporate team building.
description: Virtual Room is an award-winning team virtual reality experience located in Chinatown. Blending the escape room concept with a full 3D cinematic experience to deliver a unique, immersive and mind-blowing adventure lasting ~40-50 minutes.
name: Virtual Room: Virtual Reality Escape Room Adventure

reviews.text:
Nice experience. We did the time travel - 1
Well designed game and engaging too. We were told that pictures from the game would be sent to us in a couple of days. I also followed up with the team and they mentioned the pictures would be sent to us. Its been 2 weeks now and I followed up second time. One of the staff informed me they no longer have the pictures today and they are deleted. He didn't seem to care and wasn't even apologetic about it. Quite disappointing

Really fun and mind-blowing VR experience! Best with a group of 4. Like playing an escape room but in a virtual world. Played 3 chapters so far, and I'm still awed every time. Highly recommend for team bonding or just a good time with friends.

Was really surprised at how much fun this was! Just went as a pair and did Chapter 2, but would defs go back as a group and do the Zombies. Super entraining and good value (altho was on sale when I purchased).  It's cold tho, so wear extra layers.

Really good VR experience. Been here 3 times so far.

The first time I tried mission 1, was blown away with it as it was a first of a kind VR experience so amazing.

Mission 2 was a decent experience but nothing great. Had very high expectations after first visit so it was okay.

Still have to try mission 3, and based on the trailer it looks quite thrilling!

The place and the structure is nice. But we finished level 1 in 20 minutes and even though is was fun, you can definitely find other things to better invest your money. It would have been fun if it would really lay the 40-50 min they claim

address.buildingName: BIG BUS & DUCK Tourist Hub @ Suntec City Convention Centre

admissionInfo: Book online, call +65 6338 6877 or email sales@ducktours.com.sg to reserve and secure your DUCKtour. Please check-in 30 minutes prior to tour timing.
body:
#BigSavings of up to 35% on selected tickets when you #SingaporeRediscovers with Singapore DUCKtours and Big Bus Singapore. Book your tickets now or find out more at the Singapore DUCKtours official website.

The Original DUCKtours @ Suntec City is the Singapore Tourism Award Winning Attraction. First in Singapore, an impressive 17 year perfect safety record, and 1 million passengers – nothing comes close to the Original DUCKtours @ Suntec City. This hour-long adventure starts with splashing into the Marina Bay and swimming off like a duck for a picturesque harbour tour before waddling back on land for a city tour of the historical Civic District.

Climb aboard a refurbished Vietnam War amphibious vehicle for a unique tour of Singapore. Depart from Suntec City, and start your land and water adventure with a big splash into the Marina Bay!

Cruise along Marina Bay, where you can admire views of the bustling urban city's skyline and marvel at Singapore's most iconic landmark—the Marina Bay Sands, Gardens by the Bay, the Esplanade Theatre and the towering Merlion.

Your journey continues as you waddle back onto land and drive past the Singapore Flyer and into the Civic District. There you’ll see the Padang where the first ever National Day Parade was being held in 1966, and the Old Supreme Court which has been converted into National Art Gallery of Singapore.

End the tour with a loop around the world’s largest water fountain at Suntec City, named the Fountain of Wealth, for good luck!
description: Ride the original, award-winning DUCKtour! Hop-on and experience a unique land and sea adventure on an amphibious craft.
name: #BigSavings @ Singapore DUCKtours
notes: We have reopened with limited capacity & safe distancing precautionary measures in place.

reviews.text: Had my first tour on the duck Katrina and it was very enjoyable especially for the little ones. Due to the pandemic they are currently operating Fridays to Sundays and public or school holidays. Do call and check before you go. We did the 10am tour and weather is great with the sun not being too strong. My guess is an evening tour would be great as well. Overall our tour guide was very friendly. Thank you Mr. Glenford. The trip on the water was the star of the tour. The land part was just so so. Overall still an unique experience if you are visiting SG or being a local tourist.

We are locals, yet this is the first time for us to take this ride (courtesy of discount)

It is surprisingly lovely to enjoy Singapore from both land and water ride
There is pre recorded narrator that pointed interesting stuff (that even locals were not aware)
The guide made it exciting by having small games

Overall, it's a great experience. We enjoyed it very much
Had my first ride and it was worth it with the current promotion.  Highly recommended. The guide gave very informative knowledge abt Singapore history in the area.
Good experience when done with family for singapore tour.

If you have children who will be musicians this tour would be excellent to prep them for hearing loss early in life.

No refunds offered, only reschedules. Not a great tour as you can see every single view point from walking. Was expecting something more exclusive in terms of view points.

Tour guide and audio track was meaningless as you could barely hear anything.

Family of four is above $100 - consider a bus tour instead as you could get lunch too. Or not at all and walk around to see the same thing.

body:
Resorts World Sentosa (RWS), Asia’s premium lifestyle destination resort, is located on Singapore’s resort island of Sentosa. Spanning 49 hectares, RWS is home to world-class attractions including Universal Studios Singapore, S.E.A. Aquarium, Dolphin Island and Adventure Cove Waterpark.  

Complementing the adventure and adrenaline of its theme parks and attractions are six unique luxury hotels, the world-class Resorts World Convention Centre, a casino and the Asian flagship of a world-renowned destination spa. RWS offers award-winning dining experiences and exciting cuisines from around the world across its many renowned celebrity chef restaurants, establishing itself as a key player in Singapore’s vibrant and diverse dining scene and a leading gourmet destination in Asia for epicureans.

RWS has been named “Best Integrated Resort” since 2011 for nine consecutive years at the TTG Travel Awards which recognises the best of Asia-Pacific’s travel industry.

RWS is wholly owned by Genting Singapore, a company of the Genting Group. For more information, please visit www.rwsentosa.com.
companyDisplayName: RESORTS WORLD AT SENTOSA PTE. LTD.
description: Resorts World Sentosa is home to world-class attractions including Universal Studios Singapore, S.E.A. Aquarium, Dolphin Island and Adventure Cove Waterpark.
name: Resorts World Sentosa
notes: Operating hours are subject to change, without prior notice.  Visit www.rwsentosa.com for updates.

reviews.text:
Great service and delicious food with creative names! The lights and atmosphere was magical. Ashley was friendly and humorous! Excellent service provided.
Even the divers were cool and funny. Be sure to wave at them when you visit!
Could be good but not properly maintained during Covid-19 pandemic
One of the must visit place in Singapore!

Rides' experience are great in general. Although you can see some aging in the facilities, overall they are still quite well maintained and polished compared to some other old theme parks. Would have given 5 stars if not for the unpleasant encounter with a staff that told me to not come USS again since I "complaint" about the technical delay. To be fair, I was just stating the fact that I experienced two technical delays in a very neutral way. Shocked that it was taken personally.

A place as awesome as it can get. If you are visiting Singapore with or without family you should keep one whole day (or even two) for this place. Every one in your group will get things of their interest from kids to old. Also if you are going through an agent get good amount of tokens for the place in advance. It will be cost effective. If you buy tokens after reaching their it will be quiet costly in comparison.

source: RESORTS WORLD AT SENTOSA PTE. LTD.

body: The Butterfly Park & Insect Kingdom is a must-see outdoor attraction featuring a great variety of fluttering butterflies and exotic insects. Explore and roam around the magical fairyland, try bird feeding at the aviary, for a truly educational experience. With the scents, sights, and sounds of an authentic tropical rainforest, it's a multi-sensory, interactive experience that's guaranteed to engage you from the beginning to the end.
companyDisplayName: BUTTERFLY PARK & INSECT KINGDOM PTE LTD
description: See 1,500 live butterflies of over 50 species at Butterfly Park & Insect Kingdom. An exciting and brand new educational adventure takes flight at Singapore's only Butterfly Park & Insect Kingdom! Enhance your journey with a bird feeding experience.
name: Butterfly Park & Insect Kingdom Experience!

reviews.text: Went yesterday but it’s closed. Most places in Sentosa looks deserted. I think may open gradually when Phase 3 kicks in.

Nice place for insect and butterfly lovers. Lots of information is being displayed on various types of insects and flies which is rare to see anywhere. Beautiful designed and maintained. Worth the visit for nature lovers. It is situated at Sentosa island in Singapore. Around 2 hours are needed to roam entire park, read info and click pictures.

This outdoor conservatory boasts more than 50 different species of butterflies, from the rare and endangered to the more common varieties. Observe butterflies as they delicately emerge from their cocoons; have a chat with talkative macaws; or even spot a free-spirited Indian star tortoise moving between tanning spots.

Very interesting place. Different species of insect life that you will enjoy seeing. I didn't expect that some kinds of butterflies, moths and beetles could grow as big as what I have seen there. Nice place to visit.

Good collection of butterflies and other insects.
If you are really not into birds, butterflies and insects you might be impressed with this place. They offered a complimentary beverage during the visit.

source: BUTTERFLY PARK & INSECT KINGDOM PTE LTD

body: Other attraction offerings include the Trick Eye Museum, featuring various optical illusion artworks and installations, and the Crane Dance, a pyrotechnic light and water show that is displayed at the Waterfront nightly. Covering an area of 49 hectares, the integrated resort also offers diverse accommodation options across its six hotels, myriad celebrity chef restaurants and dining experiences, varied retail offerings, a casino, a convention centre, and an award-winning spa.

Aquarium (one of the world’s largest oceanariums), Universal Studios Singapore (Southeast Asia’s first and only Universal Studios theme park), the Maritime Experiential Museum, and the Dolphin Island and Adventure Cove Waterpark.

body: Consists of a  2.5 hour Southern Islands Yacht Guided Tour as well as a Round Trip Cable Car ticket for both the Sentosa and Mount Faber line.
description: 2.5 hr Southern Islands Yacht Guide Tour & Round Trip Cable Car ticket for both Sentosa and Mount Faber line
name: Southern Island Tour & Cable Car Bundle

reviews.text: Good and lovely cable car experience. Worth a visit for tourists
Nice view of sea, Sentosa island and Mount Faber.
Nice cable car stop at a cosy corner of the Sentosa Island.

Few years ago I went there with my mother. The person who was in charge to guide people inside a cable car was really rude... the cable car was almost full but he pushed us inside it. We were really sad that day. I could not come back and argue with him... and my mother became upset For whole  of the journey. I do not suggest that place to anyone even my enemy... because they are modernised facilities made by usa, under control of bunch of junkies. I never travel to Singapore again...
Great views and an easy escape from walking in the heat!

admissionInfo:
Mon-Fri Before 6pm $42/pax
Mon-Fri After 6pm, Weekends & PH: $48/pax
body: Against the backdrop of Shanghai in the 40s, players will cosplay as detectives, wealthy night club owner, army marshal, night club singer, reporter and servant. Experience Interactive theater and solve the mystery with double space, double time as compare to our standard escape game. Dressing rooms and over 200 costumes & accessories will be provided.
description: Singapore's First Interactive Role Playing Murder Mystery Investigation Game
name: Xcape RPG (Role Play Game) -  Shanghai 1943

reviews.text: My friends and I were very impressed with Xcape. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves during the game and were amazed at the different strategies required to proceed through the game. The puzzles were interesting yet challenging, giving that extra kick which made the whole experience all the more thrilling. The staff at Xcape were all very professional, ensuring a clean and hygienic playing experience even amidst this Covid-19 pandemic. This made the playing environment much safer and worry-free. Overall, we would definitely return to attempt another one of the games. Cannot wait to see what is in store!

Went for the Anabelle theme, it was amazing and so scary! Sound effects and props definitely enhanced the whole experience. Staff were friendly in guiding us as well. We didn't manage to escape, but wow, this game was really well planned! Would definitely come back again!

It was a enjoyable night at Xcape Singapore. Definitely one of the best that I have went. The RPG was superb as all of us are dress up as different role and one of us even cross-dress. It was entertaining when we suspect each other on who is the actual killer. Definitely will recommend to my friends and come back for another theme. The game master was great and nice. Thank you Xcape Singapore.

Amazing experience! We tried out Tomb Raider & really enjoyed the game. There are many rooms to explore & provide you a fresh new setting. Staff are really helpful & give you ample details as background to help you get immersed to the whole experience. Overall, it was a pleasant visit & very well recommended. My friends & I are looking forward to come back & try out more games with Xcape Singapore.
They have a range of genre from love theme to really scary theme

admissionInfo:
Free Admission. 
Guest wish to play for any rides or games will need to purchase a ticket.
body: Discover the Extreme Fun world of VR, create unforgettable memories at Singapore’s First-Ever VR – Theme Park! A total of 11 attractions – with combination of exciting rides and fun interactive games, awaiting you to experience them all with your families and friends.
description: Singapore's First and Largest VR Theme Park !
name: HeadRock VR Singapore
notes: (Last Admission at 6 PM) Please check our website for any updates on the operating hours

reviews.text: Average only. Been to better VR

This would be a very interesting experience for the kids if they never had a VR experience before. There are equipments and props here to make the VR experience feel more lively. But unfortunately when it comes to the visuals and sound of the actual VR headset, there's nothing to write home about. For me it takes me out of the experience and I don't feel it truly shows what VR is truly capable of. With the amount that you are spending, I rather you take your money else where. There are a bunch of other VR experiences in singapore that does better with the price you are paying. The best thing i had done there was the archery and it wasn't even part of the VR experience, they were generous with the arrows and the time you can spend in there. And I personally am a huge VR fan. If you come to sentosa solely for HeadRock VR, you might be disappointed. Out of all the VR experiences there, I would have to say that Beat saber would be the best amongst the others.

It was an unpleasant experience due to their staff. We played the Orange zone Jungle Rafting. After the game, we asked if the girl in charge of that zone can help us with a quick group photograph on the ride. There were 4 of us on that ride, $13 X 4 customers. And she just replied she saw someone else taking video already and ask us to get video from that person, to brush off the request. There was no queue and no one else after us. That girl clearly prefers to stand there staring into space instead of helping us. It is for memory sake, we may not take this exact same ride anytime soon and with the same group of people. I wonder is this the standard of entertainment attractions that Resorts World Sentosa and Headrock VR are providing for patrons. It is very disappointing and dampens our mood.
Good place to spend time. Staff is friendly and helpful.
Kids loved it! Not too crowded but still under staffed.

admissionInfo: 2 Luge & Skyrides- $24pp, 3 Luge & Skyrides- $27pp, 4 Luge & Skyrides - $29pp
body: Board the Skyride for a scenic bird’s eye view of Sentosa island and Singapore’s skyline. Take your pick from one of four thrilling Luge tracks. Gentle and leisurely or steep and adventurous — the choice is yours.
description: Board the Skyride for a scenic bird’s eye view of Sentosa island and Singapore’s skyline.
name: Skyline Luge Sentosa

reviews.text: Family fun. Just a bit crowded. Expect queuing time.

My email inquiries were answered promptly. I was advised to purchase the tickets on the official website, not a third party that offered fast track.

Night luge was enjoyable - skyride at night can be a bit scary at first, but weather is cooler and the lighting makes it all the more fun.

It was a rainy evening, and the staffs were quick to wipe the luge prior to riding.

Quite an enjoyable family outing!
At least a 2km down slope. Fast and furious. Enjoy the scenery while sitting onto the slow "cable car"
Loved it! An unfortunately short experience if you go fast, but I find the price worth it nonetheless. The skyride was scary at first but became enjoyable soon after
It was a fun and well-organized place. There are 4 different tracks to choose from. The safety is at high standard. Minus one star for the relatively short routes, with 11 SGD

admissionInfo: One-Day Ticket: Adult (Age 13 - 59) - SGD41 | Child (Age 4 – 12) - SGD30 | Senior (Age 60 and above) - SGD30
body: Come face to face with more than 100,000 marine animals! Perfect for families with young children, strollers accessible, with a convenient nursing room near the entrance.
description: Come face to face with more than 100,000 marine animals! Perfect for families with young children, strollers accessible, with a convenient nursing room near the entrance.
name: S.E.A. Aquarium
notes: Opening hours may be subjected to change

reviews.text: Crowd management was excellent. The staff were all very proactive and motivated and were very ready to help. Excellent service! Even though with the safety management measures in place, I still managed to cover all the exhibits, which was great! And despite having to manage large crowds at times, the staff were chirpy and polite. 👍👍👍 The exhibits were breathtaking and tastefully done. Both adults and kids had fun!

Such an amazing and magnificent Aquarium. Such calming vibes, with the background music matching well with the atmosphere/environment. Definitely a lot of species and types of sea creatures to be seen. A lot to be learn. SEA AQUARIUM also has side activities for children, and they also have theming following the season. For example, Halloween. Really recommended. Will definitely go again!
Last time I saw Max in sea aquarium

We love the discovery pool the most. The staff there is very friendly and professional. We learn a lot from him. There are sea snails, star fishes,sea cucumber for visitors to explore,my daughter loves it!
Due to social distancing policy,remember to register/apply to enter online before you go. You can not stay at any spot for long time,and no where to rest in the aquarium. Do bring your pram if you have little one.
It is so beautiful. Well maintain. Staff there were polite n they made sure that social distancing was applied. And everyone has their mask on. Worth the trip and money well spend.

body:
Housed in a two-storey building within the Malay Heritage Centre, Amazing Chambers Singapura is an immersive escape room experience with curated themes on Singapore’s heritage and culture.

Discover Singapore’s rich past as you go on a journey back in time and experience history like never before.
description: Housed in a two-storey building within the Malay Heritage Centre, Amazing Chambers Singapura is an immersive escape room experience with curated themes on Singapore’s heritage and culture.
name: Amazing Chambers Singapura

reviews.text:
We had a lot of fun!!
One of the best escape rooms we have ever been to.
The staff were very helpful.
Overall customer service is very good.
The rooms were very well maintained.
The escape rooms were challenging but solvable! Will return soon!

The venue itself is already a place of historical means. The rooms itself incorporates little bits of Singapore history and myths. Not your typical lock and key only, but very interactive puzzles. Not very hard to solve but still need some thinking to get pass them.

Location is very nicely decorated to fit the theme. Spacious and clean.

The staffs are all very friendly and helpful. The hints are given in a way of not giving the answer out.

Overall the price maybe a litter bit higher it the experience is worth it.

Will come back again for the other games.

They have very good background stories related to Singapore and its history.

Creative concept unlike other places, where its just about normal riddles and puzzles. This is a place where we would definitely recommend to go to. In fact, the history to this location is more than just a building as there is an in depth background of how this building came about back in the early days of Singapore.

On top of its rich background location, having this Escape Room with historical/folklore stories gives this location a 2 in 1 effect, especially in knowledge and fun. Not the 1st time here, and will guarantee that it will not be the last time here either.. We used to frequent here for other reasons before the building was used for a different purpose 😁😁.

Nway, we were here with our friends trying out various challenges available. With those challenges, one challenge stood out more compared to the rest. 'Radin Mas' name came out more than the rest. It may be because of the history and stories that we grew up with.. Or maybe even because the challenge was very much interesting compared to the others.

All in all, we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. Recommended to many others! Cheers!!

Had an excellet time today at this escape room. Located in a spacious and beautiful historical building, the storylines are very relevant to Singapore history. The hosts were friendly and the puzzles creative. The 1 for 1 game offer made it even more attractive. I highly recommend the place and will be back.

Nice standalone historical building and overall atmosphere.
Enjoyable story plots and its quiz/puzzles. Puzzle difficulties reflect the overall difficult stated in the game description.
Played 2 games as a couple and another 2 games as a group of 4.

body: One of the world’s best and largest multiplayer Free-Roam Virtual Reality (VR) gaming experiences, Zero Latency offers an expansive virtual space in its selection of five different games. Games include the adrenaline-pumping apocalyptic Zombie Survival and Outbreak Origins, the action-packed Sol Raiders and Singularity, and the imaginative and colourful Engineerium, the first game to use VR to experience physics-based puzzles. Each game comes with an interesting narrative and exciting objective. Visitors can choose from five different fixed packages that are either a combination of two games, two gameplays of one game or a single gameplay of a one game. Visitors should dress comfortably with covered and flat non-slip footwear; long hair should be tied in a low ponytail. Glasses cannot be worn during the experience, however, the VR headsets to be worn can be adjusted to correct myopia by up to 500 degrees.
description: Zero Latency creates an alternative virtual reality world where players can experience a variey of games produced with state-of-the-art, award-winning technology.
name: Zero Latency
nearestMrtStation: Promenade Station / Esplanade Station / City Hall Station
notes: Last game session starts 30 mins before closing

pricing.others: (Mon-Thu 11am–4.30pm) S$48 per pax; (Other timings) S$59 per pax

reviews.text: Have tried to book but discount code is not working and charged full. Please help
Amazing experience! Best VR i tried so far!

It was Super fun. I enjoyed it to the max. A fun and excited team game with friends. We was in the zombie killing game. Forgot the name sorry

There was around five minutes briefing before the game to make sure you know how to control your gun and how to play safely. The scenes were very real but not bloody. Even kids can play I think... I was sweating all over and a bit difficult to breathe with the masks on.

I like the ranking part also. It gave so much fun to compete with friends and even my friend got a champion for dying the most times lol

The bad thing was heavy backpack and VR goggles. But that’s not that bad, I got biceps after playing haha

This is really fun! I went for the zombie room and was initially worried it would be too realistic and scary, but it was fine. It's more like an immersive computer game that you play with your whole body, rather than just a keyboard and mouse. Even the older folks in my team enjoyed it.

Though you're not supposed to run around, the game is still very exciting because of the waves of zombies that you cannot fight off alone. All our arms were aching from squeezing the trigger non-stop for 15 minutes!

Would recommend for groups. Up to 8 in one room
Absolutely amazing experience. Will definitely do it again. It is incredibly lifelike and extremely well done. We showed up and were able to go in immediately to play. Highly recommended!

admissionInfo:
Doors open for registration at 10am.
Activities start from 11.30am onwards.
body: We’re an island of fun so why not take a dive off the 50 meter high AJ Hackett Bungy tower. Whether you choose to jump head first or throw a flip off the edge, we’ve got you covered! There’s also the Skybridge, a 40m walkway with seethrough sections and Giant Swing that’ll hurtle you towards the beach at 120km/h.
description: We’re an island of fun so why not take a dive off the 50 meter high AJ Hackett Bungy tower. Whether you choose to jump head first or throw a flip off the edge, we’ve got you covered! There’s also the Skybridge, a 40m walkway with seethrough sections and Giant Swing that’ll hurtle you towards the beach at 120km/h.
name: AJ Hackett Sentosa
notes: AJ Hackett Sentosa is currently closed until further notice

reviews.text: Looking to enjoy a good sunset view? Pop by AJ Hackett to visit their bar to chill and drink by the beach. Also, if you're a thrill seeker, try out their bungy jump or giant swing, you won't regret it! If bungy jump and giant swing scares you, then go for the milder attraction of skywalk. They are currently having a promotion for all their attractions, while stock last guys!

100 % recommended  place! something unique to try on!

I love that place and If you are an adrenaline junky that You will like it too!

I used to come to this place to watch somebody else jumping at first! since they have  drinking places downstairs! So it was a good jumping view at first!
After awhile I gave it a try! since I was jumping in Indonesia  only before that!
It did worth the trip and it was a  fun experience!

see you next time!
I went to bungy jump customer friendly employees... very engaging and it was fun to experience my very first jump with them. I would not hesitate to visit them again. Big thumbs up to the management.

Quite a bit of aimless standing around waiting, because you are asked to come 30 min prior to your booking. There are very few seats to wait at, so many people were just standing around.

Saw some other reviews on waiting as well. AJ Hackett needs to manage the full experience from check-in to activity better :) Service is good during the activity and it was tons of fun!!

Visited AJ Hackett Sentosa not long ago and was attracted to their promotions. It was crowded but it was an unplanned visit anyway. Bungy or Giant Swing at $49 only! Did it few years back when they just opened previously and still had chills running down my spine. Amazing spot to chill with beautiful view. Definitely recommended for the thrill-seekers!

body: VR World Singapore is the number one location to experience virtual reality multiplayer games together. We are the first multi storey VR Gaming center and is also located in a picture-perfect heritage shophouse that lies in the heart of Singapore. VR World uses several VR rooms with different VR experiences for you to enjoy. We specialise in VR Escape Room Games ,which are completely focused on team building, and multiplayer cooperative games.
companyDisplayName: VR WORLD Virtual Reality Arcade Singapore
description: VIRTUAL REALITY ARCADE AND ESCAPE ROOM
name: VR WORLD SINGAPORE

reviews.text: It was a family friendly and fun for us. This is the first time playing here and it was super fun and enjoyable. Everything was clean, like the devices and the price was affordable to most people I would recommend people from secondary school to university students to come down and enjoy with your friend. Games like the VR escape room. The escape room feel so real and really have to communicate. There 3 part to it I can't wait to play the next two part. Is really worth it!!!!!!!!!! The worker was patient and explain to us the whole process on how the device work. I would say compare to all the other VR game I been to it the best I experienced.👍

My wife and I had a fantastic first-time experience with this VR escape room! Helped immensely that they gave us a detailed tutorial prior to each game we tried. Would definitely recommend to anybody who wants to have a fuss-free and fun VR / escape room adventure!
Price was very reasonable too :)

Was looking for an indoor spontaneous activity to do for my husband's birthday and am very glad to have come across VR World! The place is very clean and fully air-conditioned. The owner is very friendly and engages us with short chats and also explains well on the mechanics of vr as this is our 1st experience. What attracts me is the VR escape room concept because you get the hands-on feeling of doing the series of activities to solve the riddles. Will recommend to try out the games here as they have different difficulty levels and genres (kids games too!) 😉😉

We played Escape The Lost Pyramid, it was a good game for beginners, the game has hints and lots of fun stuff to explore around.
You get to work with your friend as a team and sometimes independently.
The place was clean and headsets were new.
A bit dizzy after 60 mins, will try other games next time. But will take a break in between.

Incredible experience for couples. It was our first time today and it was brilliant. We felt immersed into another world of adventure. No dizziness or sickness either! The staff onsite were incredibly friendly and helpful for us newbies. Highly recommend and will be back

body:
Our Story

Ola was created for everyone who has a passion for life. People like us, who believe that a life by the beach is a life worth living. It is a place where happiness resides, bonds are built, moments are created and written in the sands of time.

This lifestyle beach paradise is where we celebrate a life of meaning and adventure, and in turn, we let life inspire us right back. That is why this piece of heaven is named Ola, a Hawaiian word for life, health and well-being, as our way of giving everyone a place to be inspired, experience what it means to be free and explore the great outdoors right by the sea. To life!



Experience Ola

Kick back and enjoy life in our beach-facing cabanas, or take a dip in our swimming pool, while feasting on Hawaiian-inspired cuisine and beach grub. If you want to pick up the pace, head to our water sports area by the jetty and challenge yourself with something new. After the sun sets, experience beach nightlife with our in-house DJ spinning tunes, while knocking back a couple of Ola concoctions. We also offer our beach front and indoor areas to private and corporate events.
description: A life at the beach, is a life worth living.
name: Ola Beach Club

reviews.text: Family friendly restaurant that allows kids to play with sand while having a meal. Enjoyed my dinner although the fare was simple. Would be better if there were no mosquitoes buzzing around after the sun had set.

4 stars for the location
Beach vibes were amazing, cocktails pretty delectable. Came back just for drinks and to soak up the sun. Good to come here to hang out with friends or enjoy the day.

1 star for food
Unfortunately dinner was forgettable. They really should improve their menu and food quality. Fries were cold, salad was lettuce not baby romanian, placed well, but was too salty.
Waste time place. Pool closed. Hostess tried to cover up saying swimming not encouraged due covid. Horrible place.
its a wonderful place to do stand up paddle, eat and other things that u can do over there and enjoy the sea sound and the scenery and the view of the sea.
Friendly staff, great ambience

admissionInfo: An hour (1h) of fun climbing, exploring every nook, rock and cranny of our climbing gym | All necessary instruction and equipment provided; basic rock climbing tips and techniques | Small group of maximum 4 pax | Programme includes proper gearing up and
amenities: Free Wi-Fi,Swimming Pool,ATMs,Gym,Serves Halal Food,Children's Pool,Carpark
body:
For the uninitiated, the colourful and high walls may seem alluring yet daunting… but that should not stop the adventurous you! Join our friendly instructors for an hour of introduction to top-rope climbing in a small-group setting which ensures first-time climbers get the attention you need as a beginner while making friends to continue the sport with.

Climbing Exploration is an introduction experience to climbing designed as a starter programme for beginners of all ages – seniors, adults, youths or kids. Beginners will learn how to rock climb in an exploratory manner under the guidance of our friendly instructors who would share basic rock climbing tips and techniques as you scale the wall. It is a guided lesson with all equipment provided and parents of young climbers have the option of dropping off their kids at the gym for an hour.

Rock Climbing Course and Programme Summary:

- An hour of fun climbing, exploring every nook, rock and cranny of our climbing gym

- All necessary instruction and equipment provided; basic rock climbing tips and techniques

- Small group of maximum 4 pax

- Programme includes proper gearing up and getting acquainted with the auto belay system
description: Climbing Exploration is an introduction experience to rock climbing designed as a starter programme for beginners of all ages – seniors, adults, youths or kids.
name: Climbing Exploration

reviews.text:
Nice gym and nice facilities but very poor gym management!

It took almost 1h to check me in which was deducted from my climbing with no explanation. When i raised this at reception i was given the usual excuse that this would have been raised to management. I reccomend to climbers to show up at least 45 min before your booking.
A reliable local climbing centre.  Routes change regularly so always fresh.
Went for bouldering. bouldering areas (both floors) are small and confined, making me feel like im climbing in a flat. routes and difficulty not clear. will never go again even if it is free.

Came here once months ago and never again. They seem to have partnerships with schools. When I was trying out the bouldering, SMU students were there too and maaan were they RUDE and uncouth. They hogged every part of the wall and while we were standing there, 2 girls told us to move. There were no indications that they had booked the wall, the staff did not tell us when we registered, so we should have the right to use it. There are better climbing gyms, just skip this one

Good spot. Two floors of boulder walls and one level of rock walls. Counter staff was attentive and helpful.

Routes were great and really challenges most. Route grading wasn't fantastic though, you had to keep going back to one main board to check the grading of each route, was pretty frustrating.

body: Soar high above the two destinations through the sky on the most scenic highway in Singapore for priceless views. Fly high above the hill from Faber Peak Singapore, through a skyscraper and cross the harbour on the Mount Faber Line before landing in Sentosa Island.
description: Soar high above the two destinations through the sky on the most scenic highway in Singapore for priceless views.
name: Singapore Cable Car
notes: Last boarding at 9.30pm

reviews.text: no air con... but now... no much other choice...

Absolutely loved it! Its quite an experience to see the west side of this country from top & in the air. It was also a time to rest our feet for a while from the day-long walking. During the night the lights of the ships and the hotels create a unique ambiance nice! Highly recommend

I went to Sentosa Island by the Singapore cable car. This was a wonderful experience. You can see the whole Sentosa Island from the Top, especially Universal Studios (one of the attractions of Sentosa Island). I just love the ride. It is of around 5-7 minutes ride but it's amazing. I would highly recommend the visit once at least. Whenever you get a chance to visit Singapore you must visit there.
The best way to get to Sentosa Island
Can see many sceneries at one go

Hold a beautiful, live butterfly; see scorpions glow under ultraviolet light; or interact with friendly stag beetles! This on-demand educational activity can be customized based on the school’s curriculum; hit us up to learn more!

admissionInfo: Ride pass option or a pay per use rate is available.
body:
Explore our sunny island using SG Bike! Simply scan with our app and unlock to get started with our dockless bicycles. It is that simple to rent a bicycle from us!

No deposits, comfortable rides, and affordable! SG Bike offers a wide range of bicycles at various locations around Singapore including East Coast Park, Gardens by the Bay, and Marina Area. No matter the occasion or distance, our bicycles present you the best opportunities to travel in a clean, green, yet rewarding experience while you enjoy the nature views!

When you are done, simply return the bicycle at any designated parking areas (i.e. yellow boxes and bicycle racks) and scan off the QR Code to end the trip. It's that simple! What are you waiting for? Get started today and plan your cycling route now!

Established in August 2017, SG Bike is Singapore’s very first homegrown bike sharing company.
description: Ride along with SG Bike and travel by bicycle to rediscover Singapore!
name: SG Bike | Bicycle Rental

reviews.text: Big shout out to Coach Sherman! He is friendly and enthusiastic. My 6 yo able to balance and cycle on 2 wheelers after the 1st lesson. She is even more confidence and managed her first longer distance cycling at the end of 2nd lesson. She enjoyed both the sessions so much. Thanks for the stress free and fall free cycling lessons!

My trainer is Sherman. He was friendly and very patient. His feedback and guiding were very simple and clear. I know clearly what is wrong with my posture etc and he explained everything well. i was clear of the program direction and he is encouraging along the way which helps. I am not afraid to ask questions too as he understands my challenges. I managed to cycle way faster than I expected. 11/10 will recommend. - Gary Leo, student(11-12th Oct, Passion Wave location)

Matthias &  Fabrino were excellent!  We had a very good experience with them. They were patient and encouraging. Giving us breaks according to our fitness and comfort levels. My son has been able to learn cycling in a short while and I have started my cycling journey as well. Thank you so much!

We would like to thank Jovial for being a great cycling teacher! He is patient and encouraging, and has made the lesson a fun one! We appreciate his help in making this an enjoyable learning process :) We are also pleasantly surprised that our son is able to cycle within 2 lessons! 😄

Sherman is a patient and experienced coach. He is able to connect with my son quickly. I would also recommend Biking Singapore. I have 2 other friends' kids are also on the same lesson but different coach. They are all very experienced.

admissionInfo:
Children below 7 years old must be supervised by an adult at all times.
Winter jacket and boots are provided with purchase of admission ticket to Snow Chamber.
Wearing of long pants and socks is compulsory to keep you safe and warm in the subzero.
body:
Snow City is Singapore’s first permanent indoor snow centre. A family-centric attraction centre, Snow City receives an average patronage of some 250,000 visitors from around the world!

The lure? A snow chamber that delivers snow experience all year round; a unique sub-zero environment that will elevate your corporate events and team building sessions to greater heights; and snow professionals that create not only fun and enriching educational programmes, but magic out of thin air as well! Snow City has a three-storey high and 60-metres long snow slope for visitors to snow tube. It is also popular among locals and tourists who are unable to experience sub-zero temperatures back in homelands. 

Snow City Brings in the Full Winter Experience to Beat the Heat!

Beat the blistering summer heat in sunny Singapore with a full winter experience at Singapore’s first indoor snow centre, Snow City! Snow City is launching a brand-new attraction this June to add to the chill and fun! Introducing Drift on Ice – the first ever bumper car ride in a sub-zero environment The only bumper car experience on ice in Singapore, Drift on Ice is a new addition to the snow and winter experience at Snow City. The 5-minute bumper car ride promises the fun and excitement of the signature carnival attraction, but on ice and in a sub-zero environment!

Awarded by Singapore Book of Records as ‘Singapore Coldest Bumper Car Arena’, try this unique ride perfect for families and friends looking to have some fun!

reviews.text:
Terrible management of the place. Me and my friends bought a 2hr session online. When we reached there at 2pm, the place was full due to covid and the next available session was at 4pm. The waiting area was filled with people to the max. There wasn't even a vending machine that you can buy drinks. The chairs also looked like it needed cleaning. When it was 4pm, it was also not our turn yet because there were still people from the 3pm list. We went in only like 4.30pm and didn't really finished the 2 hour because it closes at 6. The jacket and shoes seems dirty. The gloves were also torned. The wait for the bumper car was long. The only thing that was fun was the slide.

It understandable to limit people in the place but there should be better management such as allowing pre booking of timeslot so that people don't have to wait so long or arriving with a online ticket to find out the place was full and there is no next session. The staff outside isn't very friendly or helpful either.

Not worth the time and money to go there.

The place was small to place snow with. The main place mostly used for sky and slide and was told on usual day, we can't even play there.

It wasn't that cold inside even it was below 0 degree since it is cold place only and not windy.

No camera was allowed inside. There were a quite a number of photographers inside. To take photo of us. Each photo cost you $25 with buy 2 get 1 free.

The bumper car which is located at level 2 was on maintenance.

They limit the number of people inside. There was a queue in front when we finished.

Preferably to buy the tickets online. 1pm-2pm is maintenance timing. Locker is available at $2 per one time use.

Beat the heat! Experience winter in sunny singapore. Boots and jackets will be provided. Gloves will have to be rented. It’s not a really big place but enough for a day of fun. Personal cameras and phones are not allowed so minus a star for that. Lots of parking available.

I enjoyed my time at snow city, especially in these times of sweltering heat!!! Affordable prices for admission though the photos are a real pinch. Would appreciate if we could enjoy a cuppa in the snow chamber. Doesn't need to be fancy, a vending machine would do~ I think everyone would root for an updated snow city with more activities, let's hope it happens soon!
It is super fun but too many people

admissionInfo:
Sentosa Fun Pass Pricing: 60 TOKENS at $60.00, 90 TOKENS (+5 FREE TOKENS) at $90.00, 120 TOKENS (+10 FREE TOKENS) at $120.00. 
For more information, visit https://www.sentosa.com.sg/en/deals/fun-pass.
body: The MORE you play, the more you SAVE! With the Sentosa Fun Pass, you can make the most out of your trip to Sentosa. Simply select your pass based on your desired number of tokens, and visit the attractions of your choice. Whether you’re one for thrills and spills, or activities and adventures for the whole family, there’s plenty of fun for everyone.
description: Up to 55% savings for over 70 experiences
name: Sentosa Fun Pass

reviews.text:
By far the best experience we have ever had at an amusement park. The park is wonderfully clean. My wife and i had such a great day here. Universal Studios is fun place to visit. There's good and inexpensive food outside the park too.

Visited in August 2019.

I have been to Universal Studios twice. First with my mom and then with my husband and children. It is a place for the young and the young at heart. If you want to not only enjoy the rides but watch the shows also be sure to start early so you can enjoy both. For children they have Sesame Street live show and Shrek in 3D. Adults will love the live Water World show. Its my favorite. Be prepared to get wet though. The Mummy ride and the Transformers are not one for the fainthearted so beware. Jurassic Park ride is best for those who do not want their guts spilled out. 🤣 We cannot wait to visit Universal Studios again. I would not mind a third or fourth visit.

Amazing place to go and spend some good stress free time, especially with kids.

They need to upgrade however, it's been a few years that same rides/shows are offered in USS and the rides that really give you that "Thrill" factor is just 3-4 of them which are the same from a long time. They should look at ways to add more to the thrill which would encourage more and more repeat visits and seasonal passes, etc!
Nice food but some of the regular customers adherence to the anti-Covid-19 measures are questionable.

This street was once a highly occupied area of Universal Studios Singapore. I felt like I rented the whole place and still full of fun and joy. My first visit last year was completely different situation. Take necessary precautions during your visit 👌
Date visited: August 7, 2020

admissionInfo: Adult: S$36, Child: S$24 (3 - 12 years old),  Senior Citizen: S$17
amenities: Shuttle to Places of Interest,Wheelchair Accessible,ATMs,Gift Shop,Carpark
body: River Safari holds one of the world’s biggest repositories of freshwater animals, housed in iconic habitats modeled after the Amazon River, Ganges River and more. At the Mekong River exhibit, visitors will see the endangered Mekong giant catfish up close. Land animals such as the Brazilian tapir, jaguar and giant anteater can be spotted from the Amazon River Quest boat ride. Giant pandas Kai Kai and Jia Jia, on a 10-year loan from China, dwell in the Yangtze River zone.
description: Embark on a journey of discovery into one of the world's largest repostitories for river dwelling animals. Let your curiousity run wild across 2 zones in the park - Rivers of the World and Wild Amazonia.
name: River Safari
nearestMrtStation: Ang Mo Kio Station / Choa Chu Kang Station / Marsiling Station / Woodlands Station / Khatib Station

pricing.others: Adult: S$36, Child: S$24 (3 - 12 years old),  Senior Citizen: S$17

reviews.text:
Its never felt bored or tired. I visited the place many a times, but feels refreshed every time. It is always clean and cool.

Animals are all well kept. Panda Couple is the main thing to watch. They are really cute. Female Panda is somewhat shy.

Fish lovers must visit the place. They are gonna love it. Take part in animal feeding, you will really enjoy it.

One of my favourite attractions in Singapore which I'll never tire of. I think the Singapore Zoo does a wonderful job of curating the animal exhibits for all their parks and am looking forward to the future developments of this area. A great place for both the young and for adults who never want to grow up. They really do try their best to educate on conservation which I appreciate.

Do consider bringing your own snacks and drinks as the food choices are quite limited.

The main attraction is the pandas, but you are lucky if you can see both as the female one is more shy and is usually in her retreat. The river cruise which I enjoy is also closed for maintenance. Still a nice place to visit and one can finish the whole place in 2 to 3 hours. For a complete package and a whole day out, recommend that you visit this place together with the zoo which is much bigger and more educational.

Been visiting the River many many times since its opening and each time has been a pleasant experience. Its a great place to visit during extremely hot weather or a rainy day as the whole park is sheltered. Highly recommend for animal and fish lovers.

On todays visit, I liked the newly added aquatic plants in many of the exhibits as well as new animals in some enclosures.

Some feedback: bring back animal feeding times even if there is no presentation. Animal feedings are one of the most interactive sessions visitors enjoy.

A river-themed collections of fauna and some pretty sceneries of Upper Seletar Reservoir. This place also exhibits the famous Panda Couple, Kaikai and Jiajia. The water ride is a must-ride, offering new experience of walking through the fauna exhibits. There are a restaurant next to the panda exhibit, and starbucks at the main entrance. Worth visiting for a fun family day out. For a walkthrough, most walkways are nicely covered so it's not really a problem during a rainy day.

admissionInfo: Adult: S$32, Child: S$21 (3 - 12 years old),  Senior Citizen: S$15
amenities: Shuttle to Places of Interest,Wheelchair Accessible,ATMs,Gift Shop,Carpark
body: Jurong Bird Park is Asia’s largest bird paradise. The park has gained international acclaim for breeding threatened species, and its large open-concept displays mimic the birds’ naturalistic habitats. 4 free-flight aviaries house birds such as the endangered sun conure and the rare Blue Macaws. Other highlights include the Pelican Cove featuring 8 types of pelicans, which is the world’s most comprehensive collection. Families with young children should drop by Birdz of Play, a themed playground with a wet play zone.
description: See close to 3,500 birds across 400 species fly, swim and roam freely in their naturalistic habitats, including 4 large free-flight aviaries. Come up close to our feathered residents at interactive feeding sessions and be ticketed by their show-stopping antics in our thrilling bird shows. Your flight into the world of living colours begins!
name: Jurong Bird Park

pricing.others: Adult: S$32, Child: S$21 (3 - 12 years old),  Senior Citizen: S$15

reviews.text: One of the best place to visit in Singapore. Beautiful place. Great collection of bird. Peace for your mind. Advised to visit early. Please wear comfortable dress. You can plan a day long visit here. Minimum 4 hours required to explore everything. I'll recommend you to buy bus ticket for internal journey. Kids will love it. You can take thousand picture here. Highly recommend specially for tourist with kid's.

A very enjoyable park with many, many birds. All the shows are also amazing. You can take photos with real birds, not in their cages, but just behind you! I bet, this park will definitely leave a mark in your heart if you visit first time!

Kids love it.. Many birds and each zone is Wonderful.
Follow map to easily roam around and zones to follow. Shows are limited seats better to reach 30min before show times.

It's an excellent park and  piece of green getaway but sadly it has to move.Has a decent collection of birds but could be better. Some of the enclosures of the exhibits give poor visibility to the birds. I liked the enclosure where we can roam around freely with the birds.

The bird park is very well structured N very clean..kudos to the bird park staff. They are doing a great job.i also enjoyed the bird feeding session and off course all the different segments of birds..so many that I am so.overwhelmed ..but we had a.great time with my grandson.a nice morning walk.

admissionInfo:
Super Day: Sat, Sun,  & Public Holidays
Regular Day: Monday to Friday (Excluding Public Holidays)

9AM to 1PM: S$32
1:30PM to 5:30PM: S$40
6PM to 9PM: Super Day: S$28/Regular Day: S$22
All Day Access: Super Day: S$48/Regular Day: S$35
body:
Hailing from Finland, SuperPark Singapore features 20 adrenaline-pumping activity stations that everyone, regardless of age or fitness level, can enjoy. 

SuperPark Singapore occupy about 40,000 sq ft. at Suntec City Mall; one of Singapore's busiest and largest shopping destination at the heart of the bustling Marina Bay precinct. 

SuperPark’s activity stations are divided into 3 zones: Adventure Area for kids and the young at heart, Game Arena for team sports, and Freestyle Hall for those who enjoy more challenging physical activities like skating and gymnastics.
description: SuperPark Singapore is a new all-in-one indoor activity park with 3 themed areas that offer over 20 fun, healthy and energizing activities for all ages.
name: SuperPark Singapore

reviews.text:
always fun! good vibes! well spending time!

I would give 4" just because It is always something closed at that park! I meant, activities. I had been there 5 times so far and always coming back!

Service at the front desk is always  friendly and warming! the rest of the park, well
Just WOW. No age limit, kids enjoy to the fullest. Worth spending the amount. Can enjoy with family and friends. Superb place.

Two storeys worth of things to do and you can spend up to 3-4 hours here depending on how long you can exercise and if there’s any queue for the stations. Price was on the high side which I felt not justifiable albeit the many stations there. Facilities were all clean and well maintained. Staffs were friendly and polite too even though they are there explaining to the customers the whole day. Will be nice if there’s water cooler stations and if the price of the socks can be cheaper. Free locker provided too which was good.

Awesome place. Many things to do from Rock climbing to Racing. There are 2 levels. Most of the children's activities are on the top level. The Entrance, ticket counter and lockers are also found here. The bottom level has more adult-based games and activities such as a Rock climbing and a ninja course.
However, these activities are also suitable for children(if they are more than 100cm tall) The park has many safety features and staff are well trained to handle any situation at specific activity locations. Tip: If you're thinking of going to the mega playground from the top floor, don't use the stairs. Go around the corner and walk and you will get to an entrance and if you climb down, you will end up in the playground saving you a minute. I highly recommend this indoor playground as it is really fun!

My girl went in with her aunt and had a blast. There was 2 levels of playground equipped with different type of sports which caters to one and all. Prices are affordable. She had loads of fun. Will definitely go again!

admissionInfo: Adult: S$39, Child: S$26 (3 - 12 years old),  Senior Citizen: S$18
amenities: Free Wi-Fi,Wheelchair Accessible,ATMs,Gift Shop,Serves Halal Food,Carpark,Prayer Facilities
body: Singapore Zoo has established itself as a world-class wildlife park that houses more than 2,800 animals, which roam freely in naturalistic habitats. A popular programme for visitors is the “Jungle Breakfast with Wildlife”, where the zoo’s iconic orang utan, Ah Meng, makes a regular appearance. A raised boardwalk allows for almost-360° views of the creatures swinging and playing amongst the trees & vegetation. The park’s Fragile Forest zone and Elephants of Asia exhibits are great educational experiences for visitors. Rainforest Kidzworld allows children to spend time with farmyard animals.
description: Set in a rainforest environment, Singapore Zoo's world-famous "Open Concept” offers the opportunity to experience and be inspired by the wonders of nature. Home to more than 2,400 specimens of over 300 species, 34 per cent of which are threatened, the Zoo has attained a strong reputation internationally for its conservation initiatives and breeding programmes.
name: Singapore Zoo
nearestMrtStation: Ang Mo Kio Station / Choa Chu Kang Station / Marsiling Station / Woodlands Station

pricing.others: Adult: S$39, Child: S$26 (3 - 12 years old),  Senior Citizen: S$18

reviews.text:
Singapore Zoo is one of the most attractive place to visit in Singapore. It is protective, safe and secure, clean, attractive and full of activities. The best thing that I like is that it is very fun, enjoyable and Eco-friendly to animals. Singapore Zoo Staff is putting their best efforts to keep the animals alive in an Eco-friendly place. They treat the animals very kindly and softly. They are not harsh to animals.
I have visited this place many times because I love animals though they may be wild animals.

Best zoo of the world!
Management of the animals are great! Funny and kind staff. Their food court is really great and the animals too. Creative enclosure and night Safari is very good. Will definitely go again. 👍🏽

Interesting zoo comparable to other places globally. However, it is sad that many animals like the orange tigers, polar bear and zebra were gone. Still an interesting place with many other wild animals. Worth a day trip for family fun and bonding time.
Don't bother visiting the zoo during covid.
After all it's a zoo, no comments!!!

body: Gardens by the Bay is a national garden that showcases horticulture creativity on a massive scale. Pay a visit to the Supertrees, Cloud Forest, and Flower Dome, which is the largest glass greenhouse in the world.
description: Gardens by the Bay is a national garden that showcases horticulture creativity on a massive scale.
name: Gardens by the Bay

reviews.text:
The place is beautiful with lots of plants variety to look at. Especially inside the two domes. Remember to check out the pricing online and buy the tickets online first before coming over to collect it. It will be faster this way. One of the dome has the world's tallest indoor waterfall and the place is beautiful. The other dome has various plants at different season.

Remember to check out the maintenance of the indoor waterfall for the day of your visit. I went once and it was closed.

There are other places to look around outside of the domes but usually it's too hot during the day.

There are light and music show at the supertree groves at 8pm and other timings. There are also food places nearby the supertree groves to dine at.

You can go back towards the city with a link bridge towards Marina Bay Sands (the ship like hotel).

Enjoy your day here !

You should and must visit this place at night when it comes alive with light making it quasi magical.

One of the flower domes hosts a restaurant/bar. The view from up there is breathtaking.

No need to add photos. Loads already available.. we took loads.

must seeing destination in Singapore! beautiful during the day and night!

i love this place during the day and even more during the night with all the lights ON.

I prefer to come for the light show around 20.00 or at night around 00.00 am since it wont be crowded.

It has some attraction to visit as well. The easiest way to reach by the bayfront mrt or taxi.

Its free entrance so dont worry about that!

Enjoy your day!

Spending a vacation with my beloved student to Singapore.  This place is very beautiful filled with lights on a giant tree in the garden.  At night, visitors can enjoy the view of the lake and artificial fountains and sit under a giant tree while enjoying the song of the Queen that comes out of the tree.  At 9 pm there will be very beautiful fireworks.

Whilst the light show is suspended, and for good reason. It was great to go and visit at night. Our daughter loved the twinkly lights and it was like having our own private viewing. Always lovely to go and enjoy. Especially when there's no crowds.

body:
