admissionInfo: Advance Booking Required
body:
Aim: This kayak orientation programme is catered to beginners for maximum fun and leisure. A bonding session with all participants to learn hands on basic kayaking & general water safety.

Enjoy the outdoors and have fun kayaking at the Northern part of Singapore
description: Kayak Orientation Program The kayaking Oriental program aims to instill confidence by teaching basic kayaking movements. Definitely a must for those that have never tried kayaking out before! So what are you waiting for? Take the challenge, join the fun.
name: Kayak Orientation Program with X'treme Kayaking "Take the challenge and come join the fun"
notes: Advance Booking Required

reviews.text: Gilbert is a very good kyaking coach. Experienced and patient. Very knowledgeable about local waters and technical skills needed for 1 and 2 star courses. Highly recommended to attend his classes. Learning how to go on expeditions around Singapore waters are very important for us to learn about how to survive and stay safe. Never put yourself in a dangerous situation.

Mr Gilbert is an amazing, patient and experienced coach. He is very friendly and is always willingly to help us out. Having him with us out at sea feels really safe. I really enjoyed his lessons!! 10/10 recommended.

Thank you Coach Gilbert for the fun, training & great experiences sharing of kayaking, esp. accepting big size guy like me & provide kayak dat can fit me. It's my 1st time kayaking in enclosed cockpit & quite worry in the beginning of boat capsizing & won't able to handle it. But after the safety training, I'm more confident now & looking forward for more fun in kayaking as new hobby. Many thanks also to Pat for all the good arrangement. Highly recommend X'treme Kayaking for people who wish to learn kayaking !
Mr Gilbert is a very patient & detailed instructor. Thoroughly enjoyed my course & expedition w/ the group. Equipment was also well maintained. Thank you Mr Gilbert! :)

Did my 1 star kayaking course with Xtremekayaking. No regrets - Gilbert was friendly, helpful, patient and very assuring. The course was fun and I learnt very cool kayaking tips and tricks. His wife, Pat handles the administrative work and is very friendly and responsive with speedy replies.

body:
Rent a boat bring your family and friends to pristine waters in the southern islands of Singapore.

Departing from ONE degree 15 marina.

Charter a boat for 4 hours at only $110 per pax on weekdays (minimum 2 to go, maximum 5 pax), or $140 per pax on weekends
description: Rent a boat to explore the southern islands of Singapore
name: Explore Singapore's Southern Islands

reviews.text:
By far the best experience we have ever had at an amusement park. The park is wonderfully clean. My wife and i had such a great day here. Universal Studios is fun place to visit. There's good and inexpensive food outside the park too.

Visited in August 2019.

I have been to Universal Studios twice. First with my mom and then with my husband and children. It is a place for the young and the young at heart. If you want to not only enjoy the rides but watch the shows also be sure to start early so you can enjoy both. For children they have Sesame Street live show and Shrek in 3D. Adults will love the live Water World show. Its my favorite. Be prepared to get wet though. The Mummy ride and the Transformers are not one for the fainthearted so beware. Jurassic Park ride is best for those who do not want their guts spilled out. 🤣 We cannot wait to visit Universal Studios again. I would not mind a third or fourth visit.

Amazing place to go and spend some good stress free time, especially with kids.

They need to upgrade however, it's been a few years that same rides/shows are offered in USS and the rides that really give you that "Thrill" factor is just 3-4 of them which are the same from a long time. They should look at ways to add more to the thrill which would encourage more and more repeat visits and seasonal passes, etc!
Nice food but some of the regular customers adherence to the anti-Covid-19 measures are questionable.

This street was once a highly occupied area of Universal Studios Singapore. I felt like I rented the whole place and still full of fun and joy. My first visit last year was completely different situation. Take necessary precautions during your visit 👌
Date visited: August 7, 2020

admissionInfo:
Group Size: 2 to 5 Pax 
Attire: Recommended not to wear mini skirts as crawling may be required from at least one of the players in some of the games.
This theme room games are suitable for all. Children under 12 years old must have accompanying adult.
body:
Trapped.SG is a real escape game attraction which is currently the #3 out of 241 attractions in Singapore on the world's largest travel site - TripAdvisor.

It is an indoor activity to stimulate bonding and fun through solving mysteries and discovering hidden passageways or rooms and to achieve the objective of the game – to escape – within 60 minutes.

Each game will have a game master to brief participants prior to entering the game rooms. The game master will also be watching participants through CCTV footage to ensure safety and to provide clues for participants to progress in the games.

The games you can expect to experience are of general IQ and logical puzzles with explanations that can be provided upon requests. The games have been designed for friends, families and colleagues to enjoy. There are no strenuous activities involved in any of our games, therefore applicable for the expecting mothers and seniors. 

We ensure that all our themes are of different ambiance, puzzles and strategy to provide customers the maximum satisfaction when engaged in our games. Our themes accommodates to those who love thrill and have a high threshold of fear, the futuristic and fantasies, and the adventurous. We have something to suit everyone.

businessHour.description: Games past 10pm must be booked before 10pm
Games past 10pm must be booked before 10pm

description: Escape Room Experience
name: Trapped Escape Room Experience

reviews.text: It’s my 2nd time at Trapped yesterday. Played the mental ward with my friend who’s a first timer in escape rooms. Game was enjoyed by the both of us. Puzzles were fun and logical unlike some other escape rooms. Game master was very helpful, friendly and nice. Customer service, puzzles and atmosphere at its best!! Will definitely go back again! :D

I had a lot of fun cracking the code and escaping. I definitely recommend to visit with your friends. The staff is also very supportive if you need help when starting off or as you go along. I also like that the different rooms have different difficulty levels. The price is also reasonable. I can't wait to go there again!

We played The Mental Ward Game which was pretty interesting. This room was not that difficult to solve but there are also logic behind each mystery. Staff was nice to give us 1 hint! I was hoping for more scary stuff though (haha) but it was not scary at all. Enjoy the use of different musical instruments to make the game more interesting.
A DEFINITION OF FUN!

Grab some friends and get ready for some insanely thrilling & exciting activity together at Trapped!

My friends and I truly enjoyed ourselves. Our game master was kind and helpful, assisting us when we couldn’t advance 😂 would defo come back here again!

A great time for any team building activities!

body:
The Fun Empire is proud to present Singapore’s first and only Virtual Escape Room Experience!

We have developed our very own original Online Escape Room for participants to be fully engaged in a totally immersive virtual environment with an exciting storyline combined with challenging puzzles.

Our fun and unique Virtual Escape Room is specially designed by our in-house game experts to energise remote teams, boost morale and build strong team bonding within your team! Available for unlimited players, anywhere. Highly exciting and challenging.

The Fun Empire’s Virtual Escape Room experience is perfect for friends, family and colleagues.

About The Fun Empire:

The Fun Empire is Asia's leading and award-winning events and team building company that has successfully organized over 10,000 events for more than 1,000,000 participants.

We provide the world's most unique activities such as Saber Tag®, SaberFit®, Bubble Bump Soccer, Laser Tag, Combat Archery Tag, Poolball™, Ninja Tag™ and Bullet Ball™.

We offer exhilarating experiences for all age groups for team building, incentive travel, meetings and conventions, cohesions, birthday parties & casual game plays.The Fun Empire also offers unique virtual team building activities and experiences for both small and large groups.

The Fun Empire is the only events and team building company in Southeast Asia that is ISO 9001:2015 Certified, the world's gold standard for Quality Management.

The Fun Empire has also been featured in over 50 media outlets across television, newspapers, radio, magazines, digital platforms and many others (such as Forbes, TimeOut, The Business Times, The Straits Times, Channel 8, Shape, TimeOut Singapore, The Smart Local, etc.)

For more information, you can check out our website here
description: Solve Exciting Clues With Your Friends From The Comfort Of Your Own Home
name: #Awesome Virtual Escape Room by The Fun Empire

reviews.text: Marvelous virtual team building experience with Fun Empire. We played the virtual escape room experience and everyone enjoyed the activity very much. It was our first time doing a virtual team bonding event, and everything went smoothly from initial booking to actual event. Really innovative activity from them that brought our team together during this time where we are working remotely. I'd definitely recommend Fun Empire to others!

Our team had a great time doing the virtual amazing race. Puzzles and storyline were fun, we had to work together to solve it which really increased our cohesiveness. Facilitators were also friendly and helpful which made the whole experience enjoyable. Superb!

I was a bit skeptical initially with this virtual escape room, but it sure didn't disappoint.  It was almost every bit as fun as the "real" escape room. :) Had a great time bonding and solving puzzles with the team.  The facilitator Julia was clear in her explanation and gave us some useful feedback and tips at the end also.  We need more time though hahahah... definitely recommending this.

Excellent customer service and great experience for our team building event. First time doing a virtual team bonding and it was very fun. We played the virtual escape room and everyone had a great time. Everything went smoothly from start to finish and the service from the company was great - friendly, helpful and enthusiastic. Thanks again for the impressive event!

One of the best team building events that our team went for, and it was also done 100% virtually. Our facilitators were knowledgeable about conducting online events and made sure that all our team members could connect to the online video conferencing software and have a good experience. The challenges for the virtual amazing race activity were also very cool and required us to work together in order to solve them. Overall job well done to the team at fun empire.

name: #Awesome Virtual Amazing Race by The Fun Empire

reviews.text: Marvelous virtual team building experience with Fun Empire. We played the virtual escape room experience and everyone enjoyed the activity very much. It was our first time doing a virtual team bonding event, and everything went smoothly from initial booking to actual event. Really innovative activity from them that brought our team together during this time where we are working remotely. I'd definitely recommend Fun Empire to others!

Our team had a great time doing the virtual amazing race. Puzzles and storyline were fun, we had to work together to solve it which really increased our cohesiveness. Facilitators were also friendly and helpful which made the whole experience enjoyable. Superb!

I was a bit skeptical initially with this virtual escape room, but it sure didn't disappoint.  It was almost every bit as fun as the "real" escape room. :) Had a great time bonding and solving puzzles with the team.  The facilitator Julia was clear in her explanation and gave us some useful feedback and tips at the end also.  We need more time though hahahah... definitely recommending this.

Excellent customer service and great experience for our team building event. First time doing a virtual team bonding and it was very fun. We played the virtual escape room and everyone had a great time. Everything went smoothly from start to finish and the service from the company was great - friendly, helpful and enthusiastic. Thanks again for the impressive event!

One of the best team building events that our team went for, and it was also done 100% virtually. Our facilitators were knowledgeable about conducting online events and made sure that all our team members could connect to the online video conferencing software and have a good experience. The challenges for the virtual amazing race activity were also very cool and required us to work together in order to solve them. Overall job well done to the team at fun empire.

admissionInfo:
Arrival Time:

Please Turn up 10 mins before your game starts as the game will start on time. We will start the game if you do not turn up on time.
We provide lockers but please do not bring big items or luggage.
body:
WHAT IS AMAZING CHAMBERS SINGAPURA?

Amazing Chambers Singapura offers an immersive and interactive lifestyle experience via the use of escape room technology – designed for specially curated themes focusing on Singapore’s ancient history and culture. We love it. We know you will too.

Here’s why:
- 7 interactive themes with large chambers to explore
- 800 years of history State of the art theming and special effects 22 chambers,
- 100+ gadget and props Laughs, screams and cutting edge storytelling


Themes:

- Mysterious Sisters' Islands:

Legend tells the story of two pretty sisters, Minah and Linah, who were inseparable. On one unfortunate day, one of them got kidnapped from their abode by pirates. Being a Laksamana (an Admiral), you have been commanded by the King to investigate the kidnapping and disappearance of the sisters at the Pirates’ lair. Whispers from the village says that the Sisters’ Islands emerged after a storm broke out after the kidnapping. Unravel the mystery of the missing inseparable Sisters and the two mysterious islands that emerged overnight!



- Lost Crown: Sang Nila Utama:

Sang Nila Utama – a Srivijayan prince from Palembang was said to have founded the kingdom of Singapura in 1299. While his ship was out at sea, a great storm suddenly erupted and the ship was tossed about by the huge waves. On the advice of the Nakhoda (ship’s captain), Sang Nila Utama threw his crown overboard as a gift to the sea. At once, the storm died down and he reached the shores of Temasek safely. About a century later, rumour has it that the crown, which has been kept hidden at Sang Nila’s last resting place in Bukit Larangan, has been recovered by an obsessed archaeologist who then hid it at a secure and secret location. Infiltrate into the Archaeologist’s hidden home in the middle of the forest to retrieve the crown and discover his other hidden treasures. He may have set a trap or two to fend off any intruders. Be observant and avoid detection or you and your team will lose the chance to escape!



- 1603: Warship Battle:

The year is 1603. You & your crew are part of the Dutch Armada. The Dutch had four ships (the Zerikzee, Hollandsche Tuin, Maagd van Enkhuysen and Papagaaiken). You have received instructions from your Commander – Vice Admiral Jacob Pietersz van Enkhuysen, to get your ship ready in 1 hour to prepare for battle with the Portugese Armada to break the Portuguese blockade of the Johor River. Which side will triumph and emerge victorious?



- The Invaders:

The Invaders have landed in Singapura. It is up to you and your platoon members from the Royal Malay Regiment to hold your fort at Bukit Chandu. Step back to 13 February 1942 and join the Battle of Pasir Panjang. Experience the heroic bravery and courage of the Malay Regiment as they fought at their last stand in the defence of Singapura during World War II. Enhance your interactive journey by using various high tech gadgets and communication equipment hidden in a secret bunker, to seek help. You have 60 minutes to decipher the secret codes and radio for reinforcements before the Invading Forces capture your fort at Bukit Chandu.



- The Curse:

Tanggang is a classic tale of a poor villager who eventually became rich, marrying a princess, and acquiring his own galleon but with a twisted tale. You have 60mins to unravel what sets this inevitable divine intervention into motion that led to Tanggang’s fateful demise.



- Death of a Princess:

Princess Radin Mas Ayu is a tale of a beautiful Javanese princess with the plots of love, deceit and betrayal. You secretly amassed the villagers to search Tengku Bagus’ home after receiving a tip-off about the possible kidnapping of the Princess’ father. Discover what happens next as the plot thickens.

- The Extraordinaire:

If you ever had the chance to have a superpower, what would it be? Well, step into this vortex and travel back in time to meet Badang who was blessed with superhuman strength. It was said that he gained his immense strength after he devoured something from a mystical creature. He soon gained popularity as he began to defeat many strong men in competitions and was summoned to the court of the King of Singapura, Sri Rama Wira Kerma. In one of these competitions, Badang was said to have picked up a large smooth rock from on top of a hill and flung it so far away that it landed at the mouth of the Singapore River. The rock came to be known as the Singapura stone. Your quest? Enter the portal and time travel to the court where Badang had been invited to stay in and you only have an hour to uncover the truth before the portal closes.
description: Escape Room Games
name: Amazing Chambers Singapura Escape Room

reviews.text:
We had a lot of fun!!
One of the best escape rooms we have ever been to.
The staff were very helpful.
Overall customer service is very good.
The rooms were very well maintained.
The escape rooms were challenging but solvable! Will return soon!

The venue itself is already a place of historical means. The rooms itself incorporates little bits of Singapore history and myths. Not your typical lock and key only, but very interactive puzzles. Not very hard to solve but still need some thinking to get pass them.

Location is very nicely decorated to fit the theme. Spacious and clean.

The staffs are all very friendly and helpful. The hints are given in a way of not giving the answer out.

Overall the price maybe a litter bit higher it the experience is worth it.

Will come back again for the other games.

They have very good background stories related to Singapore and its history.

Creative concept unlike other places, where its just about normal riddles and puzzles. This is a place where we would definitely recommend to go to. In fact, the history to this location is more than just a building as there is an in depth background of how this building came about back in the early days of Singapore.

On top of its rich background location, having this Escape Room with historical/folklore stories gives this location a 2 in 1 effect, especially in knowledge and fun. Not the 1st time here, and will guarantee that it will not be the last time here either.. We used to frequent here for other reasons before the building was used for a different purpose 😁😁.

Nway, we were here with our friends trying out various challenges available. With those challenges, one challenge stood out more compared to the rest. 'Radin Mas' name came out more than the rest. It may be because of the history and stories that we grew up with.. Or maybe even because the challenge was very much interesting compared to the others.

All in all, we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. Recommended to many others! Cheers!!

Had an excellet time today at this escape room. Located in a spacious and beautiful historical building, the storylines are very relevant to Singapore history. The hosts were friendly and the puzzles creative. The 1 for 1 game offer made it even more attractive. I highly recommend the place and will be back.

Nice standalone historical building and overall atmosphere.
Enjoyable story plots and its quiz/puzzles. Puzzle difficulties reflect the overall difficult stated in the game description.
Played 2 games as a couple and another 2 games as a group of 4.

source: SINGAPURA CHAMBERS OF SECRETS PTE. LTD.

admissionInfo: Check for slots availability and book online via our website: http://www.wakemusters.com
body:
WAKEMUSTERS is a premium and trusted water sports operator in Singapore.
As the first and only dedicated wakesurfing school in Singapore, we pride ourselves on our expertise in all things wakesurf.

We are passionate about what we do and we strive to provide our customers with the best wakesurfing experiences.
Our boats are custom set-up and tuned to create the cleanest, biggest and best waves.

With comfortable seating space, premium equipment, great music and our team of certified coaches trained to cater to surfers of all proficiency levels, you can be assured of an awesome time when you surf with #TheCompanyThatMatters.

Can't travel for snowboarding or beach surfing? Try wakesurfing with us today!
description: Similar to surfing by the beach but in a safer and more controlled environment, wakesurfing is a low-impact water sport that involves surfing behind a boat, on an endless wave generated by the boat.
name: WAKEMUSTERS - SCHOOL OF WAKESURF

reviews.text: My husband and tried wakesurfing for the first time with wakemusters. Our coach was Faidi and he was absolutely brilliant!! So patient, encouraging and gives the best directions so that even absolute beginners like us have a great time and learn something new. Wakemusters boat looked brand new and was very comfortable! Warren was also super patient with us & gave us some good tips. WakeMusters has a great team! We will definitely book again :)

Been out with Wakemusters a few times already and I can say they are amazing! Super fun!

Quick tip for beginners: make sure to get the dedicated coach option as it makes a huge difference. With each session I can see considerable improvement and for sure I could have not done it without the instructions.
It was so much fun! Marcus was very engaging and friendly, and as a first-timer I had a very good experience. Will be returning with more friends.
Always the best time out at sea with wakemusters. There are professional coaches available to teach you, whatever level of experience you’re at. Excited for our weekly surf time!!
Had an enjoyable time for our first session. Felt like they did well to cater to our level and speed of learning as well as made us feel really encouraged and comfortable. Boat was clean too.

admissionInfo: In light of COVID-19, advance booking is required. Please refer to our website for further details.
body: Located at Marina Square, Kiztopia is Singapore's largest indoor edutainment centre for families to enjoy endless fun and have an unique "Play, Learn, Eat and Bond" experience. Boasting a large 18,000 square feet space and themed around a cast of 11 original animated characters, the park has up to 18 different play areas such as thrilling slides, climbing gyms, ball pits, and more. In addition, Kiztopia has also partnered with Kith, a popular homegrown cafe brand, to launch Kith Kiztopia MS. Featuring amazing all day favourites including specially curated brunch menu, sandwiches, mains, pasta, good coffee and more, families will be spoilt for choice!
description: Play, Learn, Eat and Bond at Singapore's largest kids' indoor edutainment park
name: Kiztopia
notes: In light of COVID-19, we have revised our operating hours. Please visit our website for more.

reviews.text:
Kids gotta be older to really enjoy. Not very very suitable for toddlers below 2-3 but it varies also with how outgoing your kids are.
The space is quite big and comfortable with activities ranging from balls to slides to simple crafts for kids to enjoy.
The price is also quite reasonable and believe 2 hours should be sufficient to drain out the children's energy.
The cafe at the side also serves as a nice place for parents and caregivers to take a break while being at close proximity of the children.
Staffs are also friendly and seems to really love kids.
Will recommend to friends with children 3 and above!

Staff are quick to attend to me when I made a feedback of a strange smell coming from the play area at the projector. Turn out that the CPU is overheated. Staff turn off and to let it cool off and the smell is gone. Kudos to quick action!

Our first visit here and Kiztopia really impressed us with the variety of play stations! It's operating at limited capacity for good reasons, so it's the best time to visit now! The train rides are sanitized after every ride, and surfaces are wiped down regularly. The staff are super friendly and helpful with the kids. Recommend to visit!

This is the park where u parents need to wear your sporting gears and run like nobody business! *ahem*

Personally, this is one of the nicest Park in Singapore. Not really recommended for 20months old below to play. If you feel rich and want to see/look,definitely worth the penny. If you have a child that can sit/crawl on his/her own. There are two playarea that u can sit down with them and let them scoop or play in the pit.
awesome.  kids will love it. my 13 young month enjoyed to the max

admissionInfo: Please present your e-ticket at counter.
body:
Enjoy prawning in a quite Kumpung style environment. Reviera prawn fishing is located in the North East region of Singapore and operates 24 hours daily. Catch your own fresh seafood with your friends and family, fun and laughter awaits you here!

Baits and Rods will be provided.
SPECIAL PACKAGE PRICE! 10 hours for 100 dollars only!! 
Unfinished hours can be brought forward to your next trip. 
Splitting of rods is allowed to a maximum of 2 rods on every visit.

Booking at www.singaporediscoversvouchers.com
description: Prawn fishing is easy to learn, relaxing and suitable for all ages
name: Prawning Prawn Fishing Trip

reviews.text:
Went on 24th Aug 8pm. Previously prawned here 3 times and experience was pretty ok. Caught more than 10 prawns the last time I came. This time however, throughout the entire 1 hr there wasn’t even one bite on both mine and my friend’s line. Everytime we check, the bait is full, no change. Even when I didn’t catch any prawns last time, the bait will at least be eaten without us realising but this time there just wasn’t any prawn biting.

About 8.30pm, staff added some prawns. Still no bite. Then realised the people across us were using their own bait and catching lots. People around us who didn’t have their own bait were also not catching anything at all, not even so much of a bite.

Real waste of $20, ORTO should consider seperating people who brought their own bait from those who didn’t. Otherwise, they might as well just give all the prawns to the people who brought their own baits instead of releasing into the pond.

Very, very poor shrimp fishing experience, poor service, high prices. More than ten people gathered around a super small shrimp pond fishing shrimp, catch rate is low!! The shrimp are very small! The most important thing is the whole process their service sucks to the point where you don't want to go twice!!

There's saltwater pond and freshwater pond. electric grill for bbq. salt and sauce provided. saltwater prawns have natural salt taste. fresh water prawns and lobsters need additional salt. staff aren't the friendliest but still tolerable. caught 25+ prawns with my mother and friend there in 3 hours.

Went there last Friday with 2 other friends and honestly,best experience ever,the excitement when you catch the prawn and my friends kinda freaked out when the prawn pinched me but it is a very good place to prawn at,I will visit there again in the future

Did prawning for 4hrs, definitely expensive but the point is the experience rather than the food. BBQ-ing the prawns after you caught them is a whole new experience. Price per hour is too steep, only 3hrs is worth it, but you must know some tactics at least to have a decent catch. Bring your own butter for a delicious BBQ experience.

admissionInfo:
Choose your pass and make the purchase on www.gocity.com/singapore. 
Right away, you can then explore and enter all the attractions conveniently with your contactless mobile pass.
body:
Rediscover Singapore's magic with free admission to 35+ of the best attractions in Singapore. Explore and enter all the attractions conveniently with our contactless mobile pass. Pay nothing at the gate, visit when it suits you and choose where to go on the day.

Take advantage of our steep discounts of up to 52% vs. attraction gate prices. 

Enjoy peace of mind with our 30-day free cancellation & activate your pass anytime in the next 12 months.
description: Get Free Admission to 35+ attractions with Go Singapore Pass ®
name: Go Singapore City Pass

reviews.text:
We took the tour as part of our hotel stay package (Mandarin Oriental) on 16 Mar 2020 (Mon) 3.30pm.
Our family thoroughly enjoy the ride, especially our 2 little ones. Captain Toh and his team were fantastic. The ride is educational and enriching, thanks to the lady narrator who never fail to impress us with her knowledge as we pass by any landmarks. She was very helpful, suggestion angles to take various photographs for every one of us too!
This is highly recommended, not just for tourists, but for locals too!
Let's go and get some refreshments on our Singapore history now!
Book for Captain Explorer tour. Nice experience in the city and river. The tour guide will help you take photo with the Merlion park. Friendly tour guide.
We have been waiting for a bus for almost 40 min. One drove right past us without stopping. We were at a stop with a few others. Very unhappy right now. Do not recommend.

The Driver “Li Jun” (李军）stopped to pick me up even though he was not supposed to use the bus stop as I was waiting for Hop-on bus from a different company, only after I paid the non-refundable bus fare did I find out I was on the wrong bus. The driver kept saying the bus routes of all the different companies were the same, but he was lying. I got off as soon as I could and wasted nearly 30 SD.

Make sure you confirm the bus route before buying ticket.
All the tours start on time. The guide is well versed in 3 to 4 languages. The staff is polite.

body: Get active at this air-conditioned indoor adventure and trampoline park, equipped with Asia’s first “Ninja Warrior”-like adventure course and Singapore’s first “Leap of Faith”, a challenging jump station. Enter a massive warehouse located in Cineleisure Orchard mall and jump right into an atmosphere of adrenaline and fun. BOUNCE Singapore caters to a wide range of visitors, from families with children as young as three years old to aerial sports athletes. Difficulty levels may be customised to visitors’ liking and stamina; and the park’s friendly staff are always on standby to ensure safety.
description: A trampoline haven, BOUNCE Singapore allows visitors to reach for the stars and flip in the air above massive arenas of bouncy trampolines.
name: BOUNCE Singapore

pricing.others: General Admission S$25 per pax; Refer to website for more info on pricing

reviews.text: Bounce experience for my kids & her friends wasn’t great on Oct-10,2020. Kids were asked to wear mask while jumping and it was very difficult for them to breathe and also hard for then to handle mask in place while playing around. I would expect bounce to be considerate on mask enforcement for kids at least when they are involved in strenuous activities like jumping. That would let kids to have more fun and enjoyable. The cleanliness and sanitization within premises were great and appreciated.
Temporarily closed
Book early to get a slot. Keep your mask handy. Lots of inspectors keeping a keen eye on things. Kids enjoy it. Not much for adults to do other than sit.
It was an okay entertainment centre, but you would not spend more than 45 mins there I guess. Limited playing ground.
Coming here is my best choice to let my son jump around and run around. Its very wide and so nice to come during weekdays coz its not so crowded.

admissionInfo: All visitors are required to pre-book their visit date to Universal Studios Singapore and Gardens by the Bay to ensure safe distancing and better crowd regulation.
body: Universal Studios theme park, featuring 24 cutting-edge rides, shows and attractions based on your favourite blockbuster films and television series, including Puss In Boots’ Giant Journey, Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. CYLON™, TRANSFORMERS The Ride: The Ultimate 3D Battle, Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure™, Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase and more!
description: Catch Southeast Asia’s first and only Universal Studios theme park
name: Universal Studio Singapore

reviews.text:
One of the top 10 places to visit in Singapore and a good day to spend!

I prefer that place during the Halloween month since It will be open at night!
Other then that it is a good place to spend the day at sentosa!

We usually come there twice a year so we will always come back!
Friends or family trips!
Lovely dance performing groups and some fun attractions to check it out!

Will be back in oct!
Great place.   Fun rides almost no lines.  Some shows no happening because of Covid but still fun

The tickets are bit expensive as per INR, but its worth the value. You could get good deals from Klook for a combined package. Kids or Adults both could enjoy equally. It has 7 sections with different rides. Mostly consists of roller coaster rides. Wear comfy and waterproof shoes coz its a lot of walking and some water rides too. Love it now, as lesser crowds and faster queues for the rides. Just waiting for when we can remove masks in the park! I have taken countless of photos and please enjoy my photos!

I have been to Universal Studios twice. First with my mom and then with my husband and children. It is a place for the young and the young at heart. If you want to not only enjoy the rides but watch the shows also be sure to start early so you can enjoy both. For children they have Sesame Street live show and Shrek in 3D. Adults will love the live Water World show. Its my favorite. Be prepared to get wet though. The Mummy ride and the Transformers are not one for the fainthearted so beware. Jurassic Park ride is best for those who do not want their guts spilled out. 🤣 We cannot wait to visit Universal Studios again. I would not mind a third or fourth visit.

A good way to spend your entire day when in Singapore. Lot of rides and you might actually be not be able to cover the entire thing on a rush day, so arrive early. Must do rides would be Transformers, The Mummy, waterworld show, Jurassic park.

body: Go beyond the screen at Universal Studios Singapore. Experience cutting-edge rides, shows, and attractions based on your favourite blockbuster films and television series, including Puss In Boots’ Giant Journey, Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. CYLON™, TRANSFORMERS The Ride: The Ultimate 3D Battle, Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure™, Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase and more!
companyDisplayName: RESORTS WORLD AT SENTOSA PTE. LTD.
description: Southeast Asia’s first and only Universal Studios theme park located at Resorts World Sentosa, featuring 24 rides, shows and attractions in seven themed zones.
name: Universal Studios Singapore (Resorts World Sentosa)
notes: Operating hours are subject to change, without prior notice.  Visit www.rwsentosa.com for updates.

pricing.others: Adult S$81  | Child S$61  | Senior S$43

reviews.text:
Great service and delicious food with creative names! The lights and atmosphere was magical. Ashley was friendly and humorous! Excellent service provided.
Even the divers were cool and funny. Be sure to wave at them when you visit!
Could be good but not properly maintained during Covid-19 pandemic
One of the must visit place in Singapore!

Rides' experience are great in general. Although you can see some aging in the facilities, overall they are still quite well maintained and polished compared to some other old theme parks. Would have given 5 stars if not for the unpleasant encounter with a staff that told me to not come USS again since I "complaint" about the technical delay. To be fair, I was just stating the fact that I experienced two technical delays in a very neutral way. Shocked that it was taken personally.

A place as awesome as it can get. If you are visiting Singapore with or without family you should keep one whole day (or even two) for this place. Every one in your group will get things of their interest from kids to old. Also if you are going through an agent get good amount of tokens for the place in advance. It will be cost effective. If you buy tokens after reaching their it will be quiet costly in comparison.

source: RESORTS WORLD AT SENTOSA PTE. LTD.

admissionInfo:
Guests are required to make reservations before your visit via bit.ly/nestopiaplay. 

Your safety remains our top priority and we request that you visit Nestopia only after you receive a confirmation of your reservation.
body:
The world of Nestopia awaits on Siloso Beach, a unique open-air play space for an adrenaline-filled, family experience.

Embark on an exhilarating adventure through 17 play sections with netted obstacle courses connecting 3 giant nests and 2 of the longest slides on Sentosa island.

Climb, manoeuvre, slide and let your imagination take flight at Nestopia.
companyDisplayName: Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa Resort & Spa, Singapore
description: A unique open-air play space featuring 17 play sections with netted obstacle courses connecting 3 giant nests and 2 of the longest slides on Sentosa island.
name: Nestopia

reviews.text: A great place for kids to play with high rise slides and climb. And also for parents to rest and enjoy.

Other than Chinese people refusing to wear masks, and no law for them, this is a nice place for kids to enjoy. Service of the staff was very good probably owing to the fact that this place is maintained by Shangri-la.
Really great value and the staff are TOP notch!!!
Small but lots of fun for the kids. We paid $10/Kid for unlimited play. There are benches around for parents to sit & wait. Staffs are stationed around the playground to help the children.

Fun play area for the kids. Friendly staff providing tip top service. Rained while kids were playing and we were given a rain check with complimentary time extension for the rain delay. Highly recommended!

admissionInfo: Wings of Time (7.40 pm and 8.40 pm): $18.00 (Standard Seat) $23.00 (Premium Seat)
body: Catch TripAdvisor’s #1 show in Sentosa, the award-winning Wings of Time. Be mesmerised by a multi-sensory presentation of water displays, lasers and fire works that depicts the magical adventures of Shahbaz, Rachel and Felix through time.
description: Voted #1 Show in Sentosa by TripAdvisor
name: Wings of Time
notes: Show time: 19:40 Hrs & 18.40 Hrs Daily

reviews.text: The Best ever light show i ever seen..! This is a brilliant piece of work. They placed  laser lights around the stage. First they blow the water all over the stage and then by using laser lights, They played a really good show. THis is a must visit place in sentosa island. This light show is only played during nights. So i recommend to book tickets earlier and enjoy the show. This is played at the seashore. The view is magnificient. This is one of the wonders of Sentosa
it was very great show. ive been here in 2011 and i really wish could come here again next time

The signature lightning, laser, and dancing fountain show of Sentosa Island. The story itself is a bit bland, but the overall show is enjoyable. It's a nice end of day activity before wrapping it up and getting some good night rest.

The VIP seats located in the centre back, but I think the normal seat as long as you're in the centre area is good enough. Plenty of space on weekdays but not sure on weekends. Getting here is easy using the Sentosa Monorail, stop at the end of the line; Beach Station.
A very unique experience. The story is slightly cheesy but the special effects with the light and water are amazing. Well worth it.

Beautiful, entertaining and great to watch
Sound effects, technology, firecrackers and the story as a whole were pretty amazing!

source: MOUNT FABER LEISURE GROUP PTE. LTD.

body: PLAY! by Kinderplay is a Cartoon Network-themed indoor playground located at Changi Airport Terminal 3. Come join Ben10 and the Powerpuff Girls in an action-packed adventure of fun! From slides to ballpits, there's even a wipe-out bouncy zone too! Read more here.
description: The latest playground in the East is located at Changi Airport Terminal 3! Be ready to meet with Ben10 and the Powerpuff Girls!
name: PLAY! by KinderPlay

admissionInfo: Sentosa Line: $3.00 (Adult), $2.00 (Child)
body:
Journey over breath-taking aerial views of jungle, sand and sea on the Sentosa Line Cable Car as it takes you to over 20 attractions on Sentosa.

Choose your stop at the Merlion station, Imbiah Lookout station and Siloso Point station and get easy access to the sandy beaches, Madame Tussauds Singapore, Mega Adventure Park, Skyline Luge Sentosa, Universal Studios Singapore and the S.E.A. Aquarium and more.
description: Fly over to 20+ attractions on Sentosa at locals exclusive rate
name: [Local Exclusive] Sentosa Line at $3.00

reviews.text:
Great service and delicious food with creative names! The lights and atmosphere was magical. Ashley was friendly and humorous! Excellent service provided.
Even the divers were cool and funny. Be sure to wave at them when you visit!
Could be good but not properly maintained during Covid-19 pandemic
One of the must visit place in Singapore!

Rides' experience are great in general. Although you can see some aging in the facilities, overall they are still quite well maintained and polished compared to some other old theme parks. Would have given 5 stars if not for the unpleasant encounter with a staff that told me to not come USS again since I "complaint" about the technical delay. To be fair, I was just stating the fact that I experienced two technical delays in a very neutral way. Shocked that it was taken personally.

A place as awesome as it can get. If you are visiting Singapore with or without family you should keep one whole day (or even two) for this place. Every one in your group will get things of their interest from kids to old. Also if you are going through an agent get good amount of tokens for the place in advance. It will be cost effective. If you buy tokens after reaching their it will be quiet costly in comparison.

source: MOUNT FABER LEISURE GROUP PTE. LTD.

admissionInfo:
Please visit Pororo Park Singapore's website to purchase tickets 
www.pororoparksg.com
body: Join Pororo the Little Penguin and his beloved friends for an adventure at Singapore’s first character-based kids indoor playground, Pororo Park Singapore! Hop on Pororo Express train ride, chill in Pororo’s House, dive into the Shark Ball Pool, slide and climb at Poby's Play Gym or even sing and dance along with Pororo & Friends in their live performances! Perfect for children aged 2 to 6 years old, Pororo Park Singapore will surely offer a memorable time for you and your family.
description: Indoor Themed Playground based on the popular animation "Pororo the little penguin" located at Marina Square
name: Pororo Park Singapore

reviews.text:
Went to the outlet at Marina Square. We had to make a booking to meet the quota, so there is control in the number of children that are allowed to play there.
The moment we went in ,  we were greeted by staff, and had our hands sanitized and we checked into the place.
There were shoe racks for the kids to put their shoes away.My Daughter had loads of fun, there was ball pit, and a wood pebbles to play some scoop and pour activities, there was a supermarket play area to scan and buy vegetables and fruits, which is very good for play pretend.
There was even a train ride !! That was a highlight of the 2 hours playtime where my girl rang the conductor bell!! She meet one of Pororo main mascot and was happy that she is able to say hi and take many pictures as well
We had an awesome time there, where she played with her friend and cousin. Highly recommend going there with your kids! Its well sanitized and kept very clean and tidy.

Highly recommend!! The park has a great environment for the kids and parents. Very tidy and clean. The staffs there were all very kind and helpful and they’re very interactive with the kids, they execute their work perfectly and I loved it. I brought my 1yr old niece and she really had a blast, the facilities were made for all ages of children. Safety measures were well implemented. All in all we had a safe and extravagant time there even with Covid-19 measures applied. Will want to come again to Pororo Park!! :))

Expensive, have additional price for parents
old and small
All toys for babys battery not working
Very bad

Even the covid-19 period, it didnt stop my family to visit Pororo park @ marina square.

Friendly and helpful crew, convenient with cafe and importantly my kids love it and you know what?! A happy kid is a happy parent.

High recommended to parents that kids likes playhouse.

Pricey for 2 hours. Small play area. Not much to do after some point of time. The train ride is very short. The ball pit is small. The gym area with slides is good. I did not see any bouncy castle. There was no show. All the battery operated toys I came across would not work - because there were no batteries installed inside. Some of the toys were partly broken, for eg., the bed of the dump trucks had come off and could not be fixed. Extra coins to be paid for the coin-operated ride inside. I found hair and other foreign particles in the hinoki wood pit area. On the positive side, friendly staff for train rides.

admissionInfo:
Adults (13-59 yrs) $25, Child (4-12 yrs) $20, Senior (60 yrs above) $20.

Open daily from 10am to 6pm (last admission 5pm)
body: Get ready to let your imagination run wild in Trick Eye Museum Singapore, an internationally renowned 3D art museum from Korea. With its huge array of art exhibits hand-painted by dedicated Korean artists, each exhibit comes alive with the use of a special art technique that makes 2D art pop up into 3D. Feel, touch and interact with the exhibits in 6 different zones, and enjoy a day filled with fun, laughter, adventure and excitement. With Trick Eye Museum’s very own Augmented Reality mobile app, you will discover a hidden world of Augmented Reality seen only through the app. Download the “Trickeye” app and watch as your photos and videos come alive with hidden animals, magic, fireworks and other special effects!
description: Singapore's First 3D + AR Museum
name: Trick Eye Museum Singapore
notes: Open on weekends and public holidays

reviews.text: Super cool and nice attraction. Amazing use of technology to make the experience even more exciting. My kids were thrilled.
Surprisingly great, very fun to take loads of interesting,  beautiful pictures. Pretty challenging poses, laying flat on floor and other fun optical illusion pictures. Definitely worth going!
Lots of fun for a bunch of ppl . Not as much fun solo . The app u use to bring the dioramas alive  is extraordinary
Brought my parents to go trick eyes musuem. We have so much fun!

There are currently(18 July 2020) no on-site tickets sale. Tickets are to be purchase online. There is also an app to be downloaded so that there will be enhanced AR visuals in your video or photos. There are several sections in this petite museum. Each section have around 4 to 5 photo areas with recommended photographer positioning point. It fun and enjoyable thou the price is on the high side. As we are still in the Convid 19 situation, there are literally no other customers beside ourselves and best part is that you get to unmask yourselves to take photos.

body: Tucked away in a corner of Pulau Ubin— an island off mainland Singapore—is an approximately 100-hectare wetlands teeming with wildlife. Visitors will need to catch a ferry to get to this treasure trove of biodiversity. Once on the island, they can hire a van or rent a bicycle from the main village. The more adventurous can hike to the wetlands in about 40 minutes. The one-kilometre board walk along the coast is a convenient way to view the rich plant and marine life, while a 20-metre-tall viewing tower also gives visitors a chance to observe birds like the Collared Kingfisher and Straw-headed Bulbul. Guided tours are available, while educational information about Chek Jawa can be found at the Visitor Centre and viewing jetty.
description: With its abundant wildlife and lush greenery, Pulau Ubin is a haven for nature lovers.
name: Pulau Ubin and Chek Jawa

pricing.others: One-way boat trip to or from Pulau Ubin S$3

reviews.text: Awwwww...this place!! Must come!
Very nice and scenic walk.  Great outdoors.  Avoid eating or carrying food items else the monkeys will snatch and there are lots of them about.
Don't really understand the hype of this place. Filled the trash.
Serene

My advice is if you want to take a trip to  pulau ubin with the aim to Puaka Hill and check jawa, you have to rent a bicycle or take a taxi van, because it will be tiring to walk for kilometers, but if you only come to Puaka Hill, you guys can walk so it is more economical because the track is not too tiring.

check my instagram
_caramelmarcchitato _

admissionInfo: Free
body: Singapore’s first ASEAN Heritage Park, Sungei Buloh is home to rich biodiversity. There are numerous walking trails and wheelchair-accessible paths throughout the 202-hectare nature reserve, and visitors can discover its native inhabitants such as otters, crabs, water snakes and monitor lizards. Bird-watchers can take the Migratory Bird Trail that goes around the Buloh Tidal Ponds and admire resident birds like herons, kingfishers and sunbirds. Children will enjoy the Junior Adventure Trail—minutes from the Visitor Centre— where they can mirror the movements of a crab or mudskipper among the mangroves. Free guided walks (max 20 pax) are conducted in English by certified attendants on Saturday mornings. Registration is mandatory, so travellers should check out the website for more information on the activities. A ten-minute drive from Sungei Buloh is Kranji Marshes (www.nparks.gov.sg/ gardens-parks-and-nature/parks-and-nature-reserves/kranji-marshes), which also supports a rich biodiversity of flora and fauna.
description: At this ecological wonder, visitors can learn about the reserve's rich biovidersity through guided tours.
name: Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve

reviews.text: Nice place. One part of this place is for visitors to enjoy creativity, nature, park kind of. But  other side is mainly for bird watching and designed with sitting arrangements for bird watching without disturbing birds.

I love this place as it is surrounded by the beauties of nature. The animals there are wonderful and I really enjoyed the trip as I could also see Malaysia from a distance. I recommend anyone to go there.

The place has changed from the many years that I have visited. It has become more touristy. Good place to go for a walk in the nature. Some interesting 'attractions' which will make the walk worth going.
Nice spot for a nature walk , looking at some crocodiles. Some hideouts are also pretty nice spot to watch wildlife. Will also make you realize how close you are from.the Malaysian border

Good for a 1-2 hour trip. Flat walks on well managed paths. Everything is pretty accessible for wheelchairs and push chairs. There are a couple of vending machines and a water fountain, but no food stall/cafe selling food. Can be tricky getting a cab to pick you up from here.

address.buildingName: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road

admissionInfo: Free
body: Offering spaces for recreational cycling, rollerblading, fishing, skating and dining, East Coast Park is themed ‘Recreation for All’ with leisure activities for every type of visitor. The 15-kilometre stretch of beach is usually filled with people taking a stroll or jogging. At the Singapore Wake Park (www.singaporewakepark.com), onlookers gather to watch cable-ski tricks, and the more adventurous can try knee-boarding, wakeboarding and wakeskating. Visitors can pack a picnic basket or eat at nearby dining establishments. Families with children will enjoy Marine Cove, a recreational zone that houses a 3,500-sqm playground with wheelchair-accessible equipment and an eight-metre-tall ‘lighthouse’ structure, as well as a few family-friendly restaurants.
description: Here, visitors can take part in all kinds of leisure activities - from recreational cycling and rollerblading to fishing and skating. They can also stroll along the 15km stretch of beach and dine at various family-friendly restaurants.
name: East Coast Park

reviews.text: good for outdoor activities and beach fun! Lot of restaurants and places for outdoor activites. There is a wave pool as well. there is also a food court. the big seafood shops also have a cluster here. Enjoy cycling, walking and running around.

A very peaceful place for doing anything. One can run, walk, have discussions, play with friends,swim, cycle, skate and camp too. The place also offers barbecue pits with online pre-booking. This place had my soul during my stay in Singapore as it's one of the most peaceful places I have been in Singapore.
You can be almost sure that the place will always be breezy. Recommended to go during the evening rather than morning as sun shines directly on you in the morning (as it's facing east) whereas during evenings, the beach side is covered in shadow. I have also slept here during nights and sleeping with the sounds of the waves is the best form of relaxation one can get.

beautiful! cheerful! always a good walk or bicycle ride!

ITs quite a  central part of SG with a lot of amenities nearby!

You can take a long walk - jog  -  bicycle ride over there!  Its just by the ocean and one of the best places for Barbecue with a lot of BQ pits or friend gathering!

enjoy your day!

Our very own East Coast with a Plan they say 😜

An awesome 7km stretch beach/shoreline with various amenities and facilities.

One needs to spend at least a day to explore the entire stretch. From seafood lovers to skateparks to beautiful sunsets, there's always something for everyone here.

Family friendly activities like kayaking, cycling and roller blading are a hit during the weekends so do cone early!

Parking space is aplenty at different sections across the park/beach. But will be usually filled to the brim on weekends/peak periods. Patience is a virtue for this part.
The toilets could be a tad cleaner.

body: Southeast Asia’s first Hollywood movie theme park, Universal Studios Singapore™, features an enticing selection of attractions, rides and entertainment for families and thrill seekers. Visitors will find 24 movie themed rides that were designed just for the Singapore park. Enter the Ancient Egypt zone to face mummies and scarab beetles on an indoor roller coaster in total darkness. Young ones will love the indoor 4-D film experience at Shrek 4-D Adventure in Far Far Away zone; while the bolder ones can head to The Lost World™ zone, where they will witness a live performance of death-defying stunts and explosions in WaterWorld™. There are also many themed restaurants across the various park zones for visitors to take a break and replenish their energy.
description: Step into the glamorous world of movies at this  world-class theme park located within Resorts World Sentosa™.
name: Universal Studios Singapore™
notes: Varies according to seasons. Please visit the official website for more information.

pricing.others: Adult S$79; Child S$59; Senior S$41

reviews.text:
By far the best experience we have ever had at an amusement park. The park is wonderfully clean. My wife and i had such a great day here. Universal Studios is fun place to visit. There's good and inexpensive food outside the park too.

Visited in August 2019.

I have been to Universal Studios twice. First with my mom and then with my husband and children. It is a place for the young and the young at heart. If you want to not only enjoy the rides but watch the shows also be sure to start early so you can enjoy both. For children they have Sesame Street live show and Shrek in 3D. Adults will love the live Water World show. Its my favorite. Be prepared to get wet though. The Mummy ride and the Transformers are not one for the fainthearted so beware. Jurassic Park ride is best for those who do not want their guts spilled out. 🤣 We cannot wait to visit Universal Studios again. I would not mind a third or fourth visit.

Amazing place to go and spend some good stress free time, especially with kids.

They need to upgrade however, it's been a few years that same rides/shows are offered in USS and the rides that really give you that "Thrill" factor is just 3-4 of them which are the same from a long time. They should look at ways to add more to the thrill which would encourage more and more repeat visits and seasonal passes, etc!
Nice food but some of the regular customers adherence to the anti-Covid-19 measures are questionable.

This street was once a highly occupied area of Universal Studios Singapore. I felt like I rented the whole place and still full of fun and joy. My first visit last year was completely different situation. Take necessary precautions during your visit 👌
Date visited: August 7, 2020

admissionInfo: Download the ION Orchard mobile app (and login/sign up for ION+ Rewards) to redeem an admission ticket with every $20 spend in a single receipt. Other terms and conditions apply.
body:
ION Sky is closed in preparation for something new and exciting in November and December 2020. Stay tuned for more information!

Meanwhile, you can still pre-book tickets for our well-loved ION Sky shows in January 2021. Note: The validity for admission ticket(s) issued during the period from 19 September 2020 to 28 February 2021 (both dates inclusive) will be extended till 31 March 2021.

A new experience awaits you 56 levels above Orchard Road, 218 metres into the clouds at ION Sky. Surround yourself with sweeping 360° panoramic views of Singapore and enjoy ION Sky’s multimedia experience. 

Now Showing:  

- Adventures in Food Wonderland by Ang Ku Kueh Girl® and Friends™ 
Ang Ku Kueh Girl® and Friends™ put a charming twist on Asian food heritage and is an icon that evokes love and joy. Get to know Ang Ku Kueh Girl® and her friends, who are inspired by popular snacks in Singapore. An alien invasion disrupts their blissful lives in Food Wonderland! Follow these foodie friends on an exhilarating and flavourful adventure as they gear up for battle to protect Ang Ku Kueh Boy™, Ice Kachang Mountain, the Pink Bandung River and all that they hold dear. Spot local delights including nasi lemak, roti prata that can be found in eateries at ION Orchard and enjoy exclusive treats at participating stores, while servings last! Check in-store for availability and present a valid ION Sky admission ticket to redeem, T&Cs apply.

- The Transformation of Orchard Road by DickLee
Discover the history of the city as you get a glimpse of what Singapore and Orchard Road used to look like when they were fruit orchards and nutmeg plantations and how it is transformed to how we are now, in an immersive multimedia experience by local singer-songwriter, DickLee.

Daily Showtimes:
- Adventures in Food Wonderland by Ang Ku Kueh Girl® and Friends™: 2PM, 4PM 
- The Transformation of Orchard Road by DickLee: 3PM, 5PM

Download the ION Orchard mobile app (and login/sign up for ION+ Rewards) to redeem an admission ticket with every $20 spend in a single receipt. Each ticket is valid for 30 days from the date of issue, and you can accumulate up to 5 tickets at any one time. Booking can be done 7 days in advance. If you wish to visit ION Sky on the date of your purchase, please redeem for your admission ticket at our Concierge, tickets subject to availability. Children 12 years and below must be accompanied by an adult.


Blackout dates and other terms and conditions apply. Visit our Concierge or ionorchard.com for more details.

reviews.text: The tallest building in the area with panoramic views

- Nice views and ambience
- Will be good to have some interactive displays or simulation to engage the visitors
Love the Ang Ku Kueh girl special 360 show at the obersevation deck. Limited time only.
Splendid views, nice ambience and comfy toilets
Nice view n great for photo taking

source: ORCHARD TURN RETAIL INVESTMENT PTE. LTD.

body:
Places you will visit:

Immerse yourself in a panoramic canopy view where nature meets history at the last preserved fortress in Singapore at Fort Siloso Skywalk.

Pop by the bustling Resorts World Sentosa, home to world class attractions such as Southeast Asia’s first Universal Studio theme park, SEA Aquarium, Adventure Cove waterpark, Trick-eye museum as well as Singapore’s first casino. 

Proceed to to Sentosa Cove to get a glimpse of the first and only oceanfront residence in Singapore, a world-class luxurious residential enclave area at the Eastern tip of the island.

Stand at the southern-most point of Asia and enjoy the refreshing sea breeze, soft sandy beach and gorgeous scenery of the South China Sea.

Faber Peak (Optional) - Take a cable car to enjoy the evolving views of Faber Peak, the Harbour, Harbourfront and Sentosa.

Shop for your favourite souvenir to remember your incredible time at Sentosa at the Singapore Cable Car Gift Shop @Imbiah.
description: Hop on the Sentosa Island Bus Tour, the only guided tour that brings you on an exploration in air-conditioned comfort! Be intrigued by our Star guide as you learn more about the history and transformation of Sentosa.
name: Sentosa Island Bus Tour

reviews.text: Free entry. Beautiful hidden view. Great introduction to Singapore history. Didn’t dare to take a picture of the soldier life because the rooms and soldiers looks creepy 😬
An educational historical place for World War II
Well maintained World War 2 conditions to let visitors feel and experience how it impacted Singapore and her citizens. Brings history back to life.

This place is more than meets the eye, can enter via the Fort Siloso Skywalk to have a breathtaking view of the beach and the surrounding. Plenty to view and understanding the history of Singapore. Strong air con in the building galleries, recommend bring umbrella if you go in mid afternoon.
Ended up here by accident. Very well preserved fort with interactive education and trails. Highly recommended

source: MOUNT FABER LEISURE GROUP PTE. LTD.

body:
Established since December 2016, Waka Waka Singapore is a Safari-themed indoor playground, perfect for children aged between two to twelve years old.

Located along Havelock Road at Annex @ Furama, Waka Waka is 12,000 square feet of pure fun for the whole family. The first of its kind in Singapore, Waka Waka features some immensely fun play areas as well as ropes course that promote courage, confidence-building, the development of motor skills, as well as strength and balance. From giant wave slides to bouncy castles, Waka Waka is an adventure in itself and guarantees a play experience like no other.

Fully furnished party rooms and curated birthday packages are also available at Waka Waka for those who wish to celebrate their special day at Waka Waka! There is also a bistro and lounge area - The Lion’s Den. After working up an appetite, both children and adults will be spoilt for choice at the variety of options available at The Lion’s Den; tuck into freshly made pizza, sandwiches, burgers, pasta or snack on little bites!
description: The Safari-themed indoor playground for your children
name: Waka Waka Singapore

reviews.text: Separate play areas for 18-months, toddlers, and older kids. Food canteen on premise. Entry is via lift next to Furama Riverfront lobby. Nice playground although staff could be more courteous.

Weekend ticket is for 1 adult and 1 child. For another adult to enter, it’s another $23 which is the price for 1 adult and 1 child. This is the most unreasonable pricing that I’ve heard of. Other playground usually charge $3-$10 for an adult.

The staff asked me to sit outside with all the shoes. Moreover, this place is not located in a shopping mall.
I definitely couldn’t spend quality family time with my family.
Good place for the young children. Particularly love it how the staff eagerly control the crowd on arrival and departure

My kid loves it, and will run herself ragged in the intricate maze that forms the bulk of the place. It's hell on my 177cm self, and all that climbing and crawling is torture for my knees. But, my kid loves it!

It’s advertised as $23 weekend play for 2 hours but you actually only get 1 hour and 45 mins. An ok space for kids to run around but with this pricing, there are other indoor playgrounds that have more to do and actually give you the full 2 hours. Staff were not pleasant, not a place we would want to return to.

admissionInfo:
Mon-Sun 12pm to 8pm.

Last ticket purchase and redemption at 4.45pm

NERF Action Xperience is suitable for guests aged 7 years old and above.
body:
NERF Action Xperience embodies the essence of NERF, providing fun-filled experiences in an arena packed with multiple-themed activity zones. Get your adrenaline pumping through exciting challenges and foster meaningful connections with fellow players while you’re at it. Experience the freedom to play and feel empowered with the confidence to be yourself in every way. In our nation, no one gets left behind.

COMPETE

Navigate through exclusive NERF worlds with your team. The high-octane design of this zone reflects the action-packed intensity of NERF battles.

ZOMBIE CITY It is BLUE NATION VS ORANGE NATION in this epic battle against a zombie apocalypse.As survivors of the only two nations, work with your team to battle the zombies and secure the vaccine. Act fast, or your nation will fall into the hands of the zombies!

CAMP DUNE Fight it out at this NERF battle with an out-of-this-world twist! It is year 2983 and Earth has run out of resources. Your Nation's only hope is CAMP DUNE, a newly-discovered planet on which experts have found abundant minerals. Gather your troops to invade CAMP DUNE and capture it before your opponents do!

*Compete is suitable for guests 7 years and above.

CONQUER

Designed to thrill all budding adventurers and corporate adrenaline junkies, we take NERF-style physical play to extreme levels by conducting them in challenging landscapes. Build your confidence as you conquer harsh conditions and overcome fears by scaling through high terrains!

THE VOLCANO Escape from the dangers of an active volcano. Tread carefully to navigate each obstacle and make sure you don't fall in!

THE GLACIER Defy gravity on this heart-stopping slide that has been carved out of the icy mountains!

THE SUMMIT Climb to base camp in our beginner rope course or conquer your fear of heights by ascending to the summit. Test your sense of balance and be rewarded with sky-high views.

THE ICE CLIFF Race your friends as you scale up the ice cliff.

*Conquer is suitable for guests 7 years and above.


CHALLENGE

Get transported to a high-energy training circuit designed for you to practise and hone essential NERF skills!

ACCURACY CHALLENGES Grab a friend or go solo in this game of quick reflexes! Targets will light up randomly in either red or blue - blast your team’s colours to score points, and take down as many targets as possible within 45 seconds to win.

AGILITY CHALLENGE Buddy up and hit the sensors as they light up in your team’s colour. The team with the most hits in 45 seconds wins.

BASKETBALL CHALLENGE It’s rumoured that only the most skilled players have sharpshooter vision. Perfect your aim by tossing as many foam balls as you can into the hoops!

GOAL CHALLENGE Let’s power up those arms and legs! Kick or throw soccer balls into the targets to score points.

SPEED CHALLENGE Work up a sweat as you race a friend at this intense, high-stakes obstacle course! *Use of NERF Rival Blasters is recommended for age 14 and above.


CREATE

Fill in the blanks with your imagination - this zone is all fun and no rules. This space encourages creative expression and echoes the freestyle nature of NERF play. Choose your favourite colours and aim at your target. It's time to get creative!
description: NERF Action Xperience embodies the essence of NERF, providing fun-filled experiences in an arena packed with multiple-themed activity zones.
name: NERF Action Xperience
nearestMrtStation: City Hall Station, Esplanade Station, Promenade Station
notes: Last ticket purchase and redemption is at 4.45pm. Please refer to website for close-out dates.

reviews.text:
Went to nerf action experience during last week school holiday.
Quite disappointed at the long waiting time of about an hour to enter although we already had the online tickets with us.
Even though we managed to reach 10min before 12pm which is the official opening time, there were already 10 people queuing ahead of us.
Was pretty shocked to realise that the queue for the redemption and purchasing of tickets is the same.
Should separate the queues to speed up the process for those who already had the online tickets.
The most worthwhile experience is create where we can spray ink from water guns onto cloth bag/tee shirt for our own personalised design.
Other than this, the zombie and camp dune experiences are too short lived.

Very disappointing, not on the facilities but more of how the way the management works. There is no indication of venue fully booked until you personally reach the venue. Upon me reaching, there were tons of kids with their parents disappointed in not able to get in. This is despite alr having tickets to the venue. This is typically "failed to plan"! Being such a big attraction, these type of service is not what we would expect. My advise to all parents is: be prepare for your kids to be disappointed!

Quite disappointing! You can't book time slots online, must Q physically to purchase tickets.  Info given by counter staff is misleading.  Only 10 mins at the battleground not enuf time for us to warm up for the game.  The Nerf guns are too big and not really easy for small build children aged 7 & 8 years old to aim and shoot.  Management needs to review and improve on the Q system & smaller build kids can have a good blast at the different stations.  A bit overpriced too!!

My kids and I enjoyed ourselves at the world’s first Nerf Action Xperience. It is a great space for both kids and adults to have fun! So far, we have been there 3 times already and still loving it! There are multiple activity zones, party rooms and we also got ourselves some exclusive NERF merchandise! If you looking to have an adrenaline pumping experience, this is it!
My family haven’t tried it yet and it is always sold out so 👎🏻

body:
A leading regional Science Centre in Asia, Science Centre Singapore aims to promote interest, learning and creativity in science and technology through imaginative and immersive experiences.

Along with its group of attractions –KidsSTOP™, Omni-Theatre, and Snow City – this family-friendly Centre brings out the wonders of science, technology, engineering and mathematics through its unique blend of exhibitions, educational programmes and events.

The Centre also plays a pivotal role in transforming the way students and the public interact with and learn about these topics.

Since 1977, Science Centre Singapore has welcomed over 30 million visitors and inspired them with more than 1,000 exhibits spread across 14 exhibition galleries and outdoor exhibition spaces.

Check out what's in store at Science Centre today!

PHOBIA: THE SCIENCE OF FEAR

Before the age of modern medicine, coffins often had a bell-rigged device above-ground. Should a person be mistakenly buried alive, this device would alert mourners of their ghastly plight! Embark on a journey of self-discovery and explore the topic of fear, from its historical and cultural significance, to the psychology and physiology of fear and how it affects our daily lives at Science Centre Singapore’s latest exhibition – Phobia²: The Science of Fear. Be prepared for something different and perhaps learn to better manage your own fears! Photo-opportunities abound, too!

PROFESSOR CRACKITT'S LIGHT FANTASTIC MIRROR MAZE

Filled with infinite reflections and endless hallways, Professor Crackitt’s Light Fantastic exhibition is here to test your navigation skills! Can you find your way through the identical corridors that seem to loop back confusingly on themselves? As you stop to re-orientate yourself on your journey, be sure to check out the Professor’s numerous whimsical inventions. It’s fun and a beautiful insta-worthy hot spot!

BUTTERFLIES UP-CLOSE

Go on an immersive journey through the stages of butterfly metamorphosis at Singapore’s first indoor butterfly sanctuary. Encounter beautiful butterflies* from Singapore and around the region!

*The number of butterflies and species vary depending on the season.

OMNI-THEATRE

Enjoy an out-of-the-world movie-going experience at Southeast Asia’s first 8K 3D Digital Dome Theatre! Join our Science Educators as they take you on an experiential journey to remote locations on Earth and in space in this 221-seat theatre via a range of digital movies and live planetarium shows. A truly immersive experience!

Catch Superpower Dogs at the Omni-Theatre from 29 August 2020 onwards. Join us on an immersive adventure to experience the life-saving superpowers and extraordinary bravery of some of the world's most remarkable dogs in the world! Visit our website for showtimes.

KIDSSTOP™

Check out the first children’s Science Centre in Singapore! With specially themed exhibition zones, hands-on activities and fun-filled programmes in a exclusively dedicated 3,500sqm fun space, KidsSTOP™ is where children aged 18 months to 8 years can learn about science and the world around them through meaningful play. Let them Imagine, Discover, Experience and Dream! Great place to bond too, at this wonderfully designed science activity centre!

SNOW CITY

Escape the scorching tropical heat and immerse yourself in sub-zero temperature at Snow City! From building a snowman to whizzing down our three-storey high snow slope, it’s fun, fun and more fun here at the coolest playground in Singapore!

We are excited to welcome you at the Science Centre Singapore!

reviews.text: A great place for science enthusiasts! The shows are really great. The one I saw was on automation and robotics, I really loved it! If you are going on a trip to Singapore, please pay a visit to this amazing place.

Great for educational trips. Very Clean and exciting attractions! A replica of the famous Tesla Coil is showcased there. There is also an area for the kids (KidStop) if I recall. There is also monthly special themes like Insects and Dinosaur to Circus and Magic.

We went old school style, visiting the science centre! Not at all what we had 20 years ago but so glad it's still around and displaying so many science projects and displays of cool science tricks. My 6yo and 3yo definitely loved it. Omni theatre was breathtaking! So lucky it was a free entrance for Singaporeans during off peak period. Just pay for omnitheatre or the kidstop or other specialised exhibitions.

Great place to visit. So much to do and the kids had an amazing time. The 3 hour sessions due to Covid-19 are not enough to do everything so we will definitely be back. The mirror maze was a favourite with our 1yo, and our 7yo loved seeing the Tesla coil even though it wasn't running.

A cool place to learn science. It is convenient for people to visit this place as it is only a 10 minutes walk from the station. There are many topics of science being covered in this centre and has many school outreach programmes to allow students to grasp complicated science concepts.
